review_text: Hi, I am the Director of Stewardship Ministries at the Redwood Gospel Missions in Santa Rosa, CA. We have a good size garden at our Women and Children's Family Campus and we are blessed to have volunteers as well as our students participate in the planting and caring of it. I purchased several of the GrowIt Gardening Tool kits for individual volunteers and was so pleasantly surprised at the quality of the bag and the tools. Everyone loved them and were so excited! When I opened one of the boxes and was unwrapping the tools I found one to be missing. I contacted the company and explained the circumstances and was told instead of sending one tool, we will send another bag at no charge. So not only was the product fun and functional, the customer service was like working with close family. I am going to order these for my own personal Christmas gifts to give and closer to spring, order another dozen. I am thinking of how I might embroider a name on them. I HIGHLY recommend this company and this product. Blessings, Robin

review_title: Great Starter Set‚Ä¶ Until the Pruner Had a Midlife Crisis
review_text: This GROWIT gardening tool set is like that dependable friend who shows up on time, brings snacks, and then accidentally breaks your lawn chair. It means well. The tools are sturdy enough, the canvas bag is cute and functional, and for a beginner like me ‚Äî who still confuses mulch with compost ‚Äî it gets the job done. BUT. Let‚Äôs talk about the pruner. The lock broke on first contact, like it saw a stem and said, ‚ÄúNope. I‚Äôm out.‚Äù It's now permanently unlocked, which adds a certain thrill to every use, like gardening with a mildly aggressive raccoon. If you're just dipping your toes into the dirt-covered world of gardening, this set is perfectly serviceable for a season or two. But if you plan to one day whisper lovingly to your rose bushes in your retirement, do yourself a favor: save your shekels and invest in a set that doesn‚Äôt disintegrate when it sees a twig. Still, 4 stars for effort ‚Äî and because everything else is holding together like champs‚Ä¶ so far.

label: Kitchen_Dining
review_text: This is my 3rd set of Carote. My reason for purchasing was for the health of it. My first two sets I was very hard on. Multi-tasking, cooking too high. Almost burning food. Mind you, we have food allergies/sensitivities, so I must cook all our food from scratch. I cook more than 5 meals a day as a homeschooling mommy of 2. (Family of 4.) . The sets usually last me 10 month torturing them. Still non stick After scratching and the ceramic looking dark and seasoned from overheating. Shopping around, I ended up going with Carote a 3rd time. This time I am being much more careful. Starting on medium and then turning it a bit down. I am still getting crispy bacon, browned chicken nuggets made from scratch etc. My last two sets were dark grey and dark cream. This bright cream set worried me. I have made plenty of red spaghetti sauce with no staining. I did read reviews and made sure I chose their line with the name granite in it this purchase. Now that I am cooking intentionally, my pans are not turning dark on the bottom interior and exterior. They are lasting much longer. If you get a defective handle. Being they are wood, they will replace. I do not submerge the lids in water, so water doesn't get in between the hollow area of the glass and handle. I love Carote. This set will definitely last me over a year this time. I was too scared to do the stainless steel having to worry about where they are made as each brand has many coming from different places, lawsuits, and the concern with really being careful. I like the silicone spatula it comes with. Nice size, and my girls like the colorful sprinkle design. I am so happy not having to spend hundreds on a set that disappoints. These are better than the home store brands that sell indvidual ceramic pieces. These do not stick and last way longer. I have had this set for a few months now and they are still looking brand new. When it comes to stacking any pots and pans, I use the fabric star looking things my first Carote set came with to put in between for storage. I am buying another set. I just love the sizes. They heat up nice and even as my stove is. I start on medium and then tske it down a bit once they are cooking well. I never have put them in the dishwasher since they have wooden handles. I also don't need to nor would use a rough scrubber on them.

label: Kitchen_Dining
review_text: We used non-stick cookware for years before we ditched it for stainless steel & cast iron because of health concerns. We've not been entirely thrilled with stainless steel - I suppose it's better for your health, but the cleanup is awful - stuff sticks to it like crazy and I'm constantly either madly scrubbing it, or putting it back on the stove with water to boil off whatever food got cooked onto it before trying to clean it with soapy water. Cast iron is awesome in certain situations, like searing steak, but I've also found it a challenge to maintain so I don't strip the "seasoning" off of it. I've heard and read great things about ceramic non-stick cookware, but until having an opportunity to try this set, I just wasn't willing to take the leap. Let me tell you - I absolutely love this 9 piece ceramic cookware set - it does not disappoint! - It is cleverly designed - perfect for smaller kitchens with less storage space. There is one universal handle that clips easily onto each piece, the lid for the saucepan has an elevated lip so the handle still fits while securely covering the pot - The nonstick surface heats quickly and evenly, and was perfectly stick-resistant, even with scrambled eggs (see pic), which I have found stick to absolutely everything and are a huge mess to clean up! The eggs slid off like magic, & once the pan was cool, a quick wash in warm water with mild dish soap got it squeaky clean. So awesome! One important note - though the set comes with basic instructions, there is no mention of whether or not you should add cooking oil to the pan. I looked it up, and the internet consensus is that using a bit of butter or oil (though not spray oil) will not only make the non-stick surface work better, but it will also protect and preserve the non-stick surface by keeping it oiled. Kind of seems like an important point to miss in the directions, so I thought I'd mention it here... - I love the thoughtful inclusion of the 2 sturdy fabric storage protectors... I usually use paper towels to protect my non-stick cookware when it's stacked in the cabinet, but they don't do a great job protecting the surface, they slide all over the place, and eventually fall to the back of the cabinet, which is super annoying. So having these cute and sturdy pan protectors to stack everything neatly is a huge bonus. - Along the same lines, I love that 2 handy silicone utensils are included with the set, so that you can use everything right out of the box! Honestly, if I didn't have non-scratch utensils on hand and got this set, I can see myself using the wrong kind of utensil in my enthusiasm to try out the set, potentially scratching the set right out of the box. I can't imagine I'm the only person who would do that, so it's awesome that utensils are included right in the package. - That said, while the spatula is perfect, the ladle is kind of comically large for the small saucepan included in this set. It appears that some sets include a larger pot, in that case the ladle makes sense. Still, it is nice to have on hand. - This set is a great value - really reasonable for what you get, plus other cookware that I have seen in stores are so much more expensive! - The blue and white color scheme is so cheerful - it brightens my kitchen and makes me smile! All of my other cookware has always been gray and black, that is fine, but I was pleasantly surprised how much joy the color of this set brings me - This set would make a great housewarming gift, and it's also perfect for college students who are living in small, dorm-sized apartments My only wish is that lids were provided for the saute pans - the lids from my stainless steel set do work with these standard size pans, but if you're starting out and this is your first set, it's a shame that the lids for each piece aren't included. Overall, I can't recommend this set highly enough - totally love it!
author: Anna Smith
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2025

label: Kitchen_Dining
review_text: I got this cookware set a little while back to try out because I wanted something versatile for everyday cooking without sacrificing space in the cabinets, and honestly it‚Äôs been mostly pleasant to use. Right out of the box it looked nicer than I expected for the price ‚Äî the pieces are a good mix of sizes for all the things I cook most often, and the detachable handles are actually way more useful than I thought they‚Äôd be. Being able to snap the handles on and off means I can stack everything up neatly in the cupboard, and when I need to go from the stovetop to the oven it‚Äôs less of a juggling act compared to my old set. Cooking on induction and gas has both been fine, and nothing has stuck to the surfaces yet even when I was less careful than I should‚Äôve been. Cleaning up is pretty easy too ‚Äî I‚Äôve wiped them down after dinner and they haven‚Äôt shown weird residue or stains. The lids fit snugly, which helps with both simmering and keeping splatters down, and I‚Äôve even used them in the oven a couple times without worrying about the handles. That said, the finish on these isn‚Äôt crazy heavy duty ‚Äî if you‚Äôre used to thick professional pans you‚Äôll feel the difference, and I‚Äôve noticed the heat distribution takes a bit longer to get even than my old set. Also the detachable handles take a moment to get used to, especially when you've got hot stuff inside, since you do have to make sure they‚Äôre clicked on solidly before moving anything. And while everything stacks nicely, it does take a couple extra seconds to click the handles on and off every time you use them. Overall, it‚Äôs been a solid addition to my kitchen. I like how flexible the pieces are and how much easier it is to store them without the bulky handles in the way. For everyday cooking it checks all the boxes for me, and I‚Äôve reached for it way more than I thought I would when I first opened the box.

label: Kitchen_Dining
review_title: Compact, Beautiful, and Perfect for Small Kitchens or First Apartments
review_text: This Malta Blue Carote set is such a pleasant surprise. The color is bright and cheerful without feeling childish, and the ceramic interior gives it a clean, polished look. Although this is a smaller nine piece set, the essentials are all here. You get two frying pans, a saucepan with a silicone rimmed lid, utensils, pan protectors, and the removable handle system. Everything feels sturdy, and the nonstick performance is just as reliable as the larger Carote sets I already own. One of the standout features is how beginner friendly this set is. Someone who is just setting up a kitchen does not need a dozen specialty pieces. They need the core pieces that will carry them through everyday meals, and this set delivers exactly that. The detachable handle design keeps the whole collection compact, and once the handle is removed, the pieces nest tightly together. It saves a tremendous amount of cabinet space, which is especially helpful for new cooks who may be working with a limited kitchen. The silicone lid also makes it easy to cook, store, and reheat in the same pot without moving food around. This set also makes a thoughtful gift. It is affordable without feeling cheap, and it gives the recipient a practical but attractive start. Whether it is for someone moving into a dorm, a first apartment, or even an RV, this little set checks every box. It heats evenly, it cleans beautifully, and it looks far more expensive than the current price. A lovely, useful, confidence boosting starter set. Five stars.
author: Lynda B.

label: Kitchen_Dining
review_title: I don't know why I didn't go stainless steel until now! - update
review_text: The media could not be loaded. UPDATE: I just had to update this review. I fried an egg and as you can see, with the proper knowledge, this egg slid around the pan just like those fancy pots and pans with little to no clean up.! I don't like to cook, I do not eat a lot of fried foods and I rarely give 5 stars. I did my homework on cooking with stainless steel. You CAN NOT cook the same as you have on that nasty nonstick stuff. I wanted to wait until I used both a saucepan and frypan. Saucepan: I boil my chicken and add Mrs. Dash to the water. Normally, there would be bubbling/seasoning stuck all over the sides at this point. The pictures shows no sticking and even boiling. They had been boiling for at least 20 minutes. I did put a little veggie oil in the water. It cleaned up VERY easy, dried immediately (do your homework!) and is just fine. Frying (uncovered): I heated the pan, tested with water and then added my oil (olive oil this time) (all as instructed by DOING MY HOMEWORK). Onions was all I had, so I cut them up and put them in for saut√©ing. Once they started to brown, I reduced the heat from low/medium to low. I stirred them until I was happy with the coloring and then took my 2 squares of ground turkey (I package my meat in single servings to freeze) laid them on top of the onions, salt and peppered them and cut them into sections for frying. After about 10 minutes I went back and they moved easily with NO sticking. After 20 minutes I flipped them and dumped some parmesan cheese on top. Once done, I removed them and made 3 meals out of it. You can see the condition of the pan immediately after removing the food. It is nearly clean and there's still oil in the pan! I could have easily washed it at that point, but I wanted to eat :) I put some hot water in the pan and set it back on the burner, now turned off. I went out 30 minutes later and was able to wipe it clean with just a warm soapy dish rag. Easy peasy! Utensil: A wooden spoon (of sorts). It only has a slight depression so I guess it's not really a 'spoon', however, it is what I used for the entire process, flipping and all. This is just a basic set, but it is all "I" need. I have a cast iron grill pan for steaks and bacon and a small one for a turkey burger when I'm in a hurry. Also, I used the cardboard inserts they came with for spacers until I found-https://www.amazon.com/dp/B087M6W31J?psc=1&ref=ppx_yo2ov_dt_b_product_details. Who knew of such things :) So, in conclusion for all those bad reviews (most are of burnt food), that's what you get for not researching how to cook with stainless steel. It's just too bad that the vendor had to take the hit for your ignorance. Taken care of correctly (and I don't think it's a lot of work, frankly, it's easier than those nasty 'nonstick' pans) these are amazing and I got them on sale for $140! I did a lot of looking before I settled on this set. It's very comparably priced and I would grab them up before they're discontinued. I also got the small saucepan for this set from Lowe's. DO YOUR HOMEWORK, BUY THESE AND YOU WILL NOT BE SORRY :) Bon Appetit

author: Cary
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2025

label: Kitchen_Dining
review_text: This is my first stainless steel cookware set, and I did some research before I started cooking. This set is very nice and comfortable when cooking. Very durable to high heat and clean up was easy. There were no hot spots and my chicken came out cooked evenly. I used these tips when searing my chicken and this should be done when using stainless steel: -Wash your cookware before using with a detergent that doesn't have citrus in it. No lemon fresh Dawn. Just use regular dish detergent. -Heat your pan for 2 minutes before adding oil or food. You have to take it from cold to hot before adding oil. Or your food will stick. Use low to medium heat. Check with some drops of water to see if they bead up. Then you're ready to cook. -Fat and Butter is Stainless Steel's best friend. After heating your pan for 2 minutes use Avocado or Grapeseed oil to make cooking surface non stick, not Olive oil or regular butter. Olive oil and butter are not durable fats and oils to sustain the heat in stainless steel, but they are for non stick. Avocado and Grapeseed oil burns slower on high heat. -You can tell when you heat is too high if your oil starts drying out. Add a splash more during cooking. -Turn the heat down some when cooking. You only need the higher heat to get the pan hot. Once hot, you can reduce heat. Stainless steel is not like nonstick. It's very different. If your food burns, you had your pan too hot or you used the wrong oil or not enough oil. Towards the end of cooking you can add your butter because you should have had time to lower the temperature. Just don't add butter at the beginning. -When you take your meat out of the pan to rest, let your pan cool for a few minutes and then wash while meat is resting. Perfect time to wash cookware! Wash in warm to hot water. Cold water will make hot stainless steel warp. Use gentle detergent. I also used the soft side of Scrub Daddy because it's gentle to stainless steel. If you have tougher stains, use Brillo or SOS pads. -Dry your cookware immediately after washing to preserve the finish. Additional tip: Brillo pads are good to clean stainless steel. Don't be afraid to use Brillo or SOS. It even says so on the box.

review_text: I agree with all the positive reviews here. These pans aren't inexpensive but they are truly a pleasure to cook with. author: JTCAT
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2025

label: Kitchen_Dining
review_title: Great quality and versatility - and fun to use
review_text: Really happy with the set so far. Also purchased the pans from Costco. After years of buying lower quality pans, which normally are only good for a few years, we are very impressed with the performance so far. The pots and pans feel solid, and I am really impressed with the lids, too. Our gas cooktop's steel grates have beat up the bottoms of sets in the past, but the bottoms of the Hexclads are handling them well so far. Perhaps my only small complaint is that the handles and lids are too shiny to hide fingerprints or smudges even after they are washed. Reading through endless reviews about Hexclad and other high end brands, I've concluded the following: 1. For our cooking needs, which is versatility and family use, these were the best fit. Our goal was not to buy the last set in our lifetime or the absolute best in the world, but something that is non-stick, easy to use for our kids (i.e., not stainless), and lasts for more than a couple years. 2. A fair amount of negative reviews (and those with photos) were questionable. Lots of complaints about the non-stick with photos of dirty pans. I could not help but feel like directions were not followed, such as proper heating up, seasoning of pans (initial and oils during regular use) and just general care. We have cooked all sorts of things so far and have not had issues. 3. With a number of complaints about customer service from Hexclad directly, we decided to purchase ours from Costco and Amazon. I feel like quality issues with products are known pretty quickly, so I am confident we will be okay should anything arise in the short term, which we can go through Amazon or Costco. If you cannot replace an item 5-10 years down the road due to cost or whatever, you should not be playing in this price point in the first place. Again, this is for casual home use with a large family, where we did not want to get into stainless steel type cookware, which I'm sure is amazing - but not for a family with kids. We wanted something that was great quality and did not require any guesswork into the use and care. Good luck, and hope this opinion helps others.

review_text: I am giving the Amazon Basics Disposable Cutlery Set a full five-star rating because it delivers convenience and strength far above its weight class. Forget flimsy plastic that snaps on a piece of lettuce‚Äîthis is the heavy-duty stuff. The organizational layout of this 192-count large combo pack is brilliant. Having the forks, spoons, and knives pre-sorted and organized in the box makes storage simple and grab-and-go serving effortless. No more digging through a giant bag of mixed silverware for a knife! This simple feature makes prepping for parties, office lunches, or school events a breeze. But let's talk about the durability. This is the unexpected star of the show. I'm convinced the plastic blend used here is designed to withstand a serious chew. These pieces are so sturdy, they honestly almost rival the legendary durability of Chipotle's cutlery. You can confidently scoop ice cream, saw through a tough piece of brisket, or even scrape hardened cheese off a plate without fear of snapping the handle. If you need affordable, bulk plastic cutlery that won't embarrass you by breaking in front of a guest, this is the set. It‚Äôs organized, sturdy, and a true workhorse. Excellent value and highly recommended!

label: Kitchen_Dining
review_text: I usually wait awhile before doing any review, but since this product is not electronic, etc, I feel an immediate review is good. Received next morning after ordering last night. Upon opening I was immediately impressed with the quality & weight of this silverware set. I like that it gave you a choice of a set for 4, 6, 8, etc at very reasonable prices ! I read reviews for many sets & was not looking to spend a fortune on a silverware set as these are for my vacation home I recently acquired & need some good basic things like these. This silverware set in reviews looked the best choice & price wise I ordered. Was NOT disappointed ! Alot of reviews with other sets of stainless steel had claims of early rust issues were this one did not have those issue claims (that I saw in reviews). You also have the choice of a normal & heavy duty set, I went with the normal & WoW these are sturdy ! The necks of the forks are "meaty" so not going to bend unless you REALLY put abnormal amount of pressure on them. Small spoon nice size as are the salad forks, the larger fork if perfect sized & although some reviewed the large spoon too big, I find it nice & large for soup as they should be ! Overall VERY happy with the quality, weight & feel in hand as they don't feel like flimsy, cheap metal that will bend while stabing at a lettuce leaf, lol. Again I had purchased the reg & not the heavy duty version of 8 set & feel that these are heavy duty enough. The polished SS finish very nice, haven't used or washed yet so don't know about water spotting, etc, but reviews showed not an issue. At $40 (about what I payed with tax & a $3 off coupon) I'm very happy I chose this set at this very well priced silverware set of 8 as a low/med budget cost for this product. Very well packaged when received. Highly recommend & if I needed to buy again, I would not hesitate to purchase these !!!

review_title: Black Heavy Duty Silverware Set ‚Äì Built Like a Tank, Feels Like a Dream
review_text: I‚Äôll be honest‚Äîafter 30 years of the same old silverware, it was time for an upgrade. Enter this matte black, heavy-duty flatware set, which makes me feel like a secret agent at every meal. Need to slice through a steak? Done. Want to intimidate your salad into submission? These forks don‚Äôt mess around. Each piece feels solid in the hand‚Äînone of that flimsy, bend-on-impact nonsense. I could probably use a spoon as a small shovel in an emergency. The knives? They could double as self-defense weapons (not that I tested this... yet). Bonus points for making my dinner table look like a high-end steakhouse instead of a "whatever‚Äôs clean" hodgepodge. Downsides? Well, the ‚Äúdishwasher safe‚Äù part might be a little optimistic. Unless you like that ‚Äúartfully distressed‚Äù look, maybe hand wash these bad boys. But for under $30, I‚Äôve got a set that says, "I take dinner seriously." Would I rebuy it? Yes. Would I invite friends over to show off my utensils? Also yes. Final Thoughts: The Great Kitchen Upgrade of 2025 Between the badass silverware, the bulletproof glasses, and the museum-worthy plates, my dining experience has officially leveled up. No more sad, mismatched pieces from the past. Everything looks cohesive, elegant, and‚Äîdare I say‚Äîgrown-up. Would I recommend this combo? Yes. If you want to feel like you have your life together (even if you don‚Äôt), this is the way to go.

review_text: What a surprise to find a garment that runs large! Reading reviews, indeed this Wrangler fleece quarter zip runs large, so I ordered a size Large and it fit hubby perfectly - as he wears this over a dress shirt at a casual work setting. ( Amazon Basic quarter zip pullover fit him great in size XL, just to compare sizes.) The fabric is a lighter to midweight fleece- type fabric, but the exterior of the pullover seems to have a nap to it... that can catch little pieces of things ( like when cutting cardboard boxes at work ) and sticks on. It wouldn't be noticeable if worn going out to eat or something ... but just to mention that. The contrast inner collar appears as a shiny fabric surface in the photos, but in person is a lot more subtle and appropriate to the casual style of the pullover. (The dark blue Mood Indigo color has a black fabric collar and is almost matte in terms of sheen.) Washing per instructions inside- out (protects the 1/4 zipper ) takes care of the pieces stuck on the fabric and it washes and dries up beautifully, with no changes in size. Would order again.

I ordered a size XXL and it was too big for me. There is no cuffing or trim on the sleeves or the bottoms of the body, so the sweatshirt hangs loose on you. The sleeves were well past my wrist with my arms down and the body was 5 inches or so below the beltline. It drapes the body rather than conforming to it. The inside of the fabric is very comfortable and warm. The outside is made of a rough-cut material that gathers lint and crumbs and is hard to pick these items off the material without pulling on the cloth potentially making it pill up. I paid more for this item than the usual zippered sweatshirt and expected it to be a better, more stylish fit.

review_text: I purchased the Hanes Men's Ecosmart Fleece (Sweatshirt/Pants/etc.), and overall, I am very happy with the product. The material is soft, comfortable, and the Ecosmart aspect is a nice bonus. It's a great value for the price and exactly what I was looking for in a basic, cozy fleece item. However, the one drawback is the stitching quality. It could definitely be better. I noticed a few loose threads and areas where the seams felt weak right out of the package. While the garment is still perfectly wearable, I worry about how well the seams will hold up after repeated washing. In summary: A comfortable and good product, but Hanes needs to step up their quality control on the construction and stitching. If the seams were stronger, this would easily be a 5-star item.

author: Fonda
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2025

label: Mens_Clothing
review_title: Several things to be aware of
review_text: FOR REFERENCE: I bought 2 of the sweatshirts in Stonewash Green, sizes Medium and Large. My intent was to find something reasonably priced, warm, and comfy to wear - mainly so I could quickly put together a basic, casual, and decent looking outfit that was suitable to wear in public. I wanted a sweatshirt I could launder at least 15 times before it became too worn out looking to try to wear at a social event. Even after the appearance degraded, I still wanted the sweatshirt to remain warm, comfy, and in tact so I could wear it while lounging inside my home or during other situations that didn't require me to look quite as put together. I'm a female, 5'6 tall, about 115 lbs, 32C bra size, 26 inch waist, and 36.5 inch hips. I have slightly broader shoulders and a slightly longer torso than the average female of my size. I have a slender build. I wanted one sweatshirt to fit pretty loose (for layering and comfort) and another to have a trendy oversized looked. I definitely should have bought larger sizes, and I don't think these sweatshirts will hold up the way I had hoped. MAIN THOUGHTS: Overall quality is "barely okay." (I guess it really depends on how you intend to use this sweatshirt and the pricing. You may find the quality to be acceptable... or very disappointing.) Shrinks a lot after just one wash - almost by a size and a half. Shrinkage is more drastic in the length of the body and sleeves, but also affects the width. Overall, does not launder well under "normal conditions." You may have to be very careful to avoid any heat or abrasiveness to keep this sweatshirt looking its best for as long as possible. (Not worth the effort, IMO.) Stains show easily on this particular color and are surprisingly difficult to remove. Possible dye issues. The large sweatshirt came out with what appears to be bleached/faded spots on the bottom banding. (We don't use bleach or a lot of harsh chemicals in my home due to allergies and skin sensitivity issues. So, I'm not sure how this occured. No other clothing item came out of the laundry with the same problem.) Already noticed some slight pilling in spots. Barely noticeable now, but this is only after one laundry session. Sweatshirts aren't very warm, but they are comfortable (as long as you get the correct size). If you choose to buy this sweatshirt, I'd recommend you buy 1-2 sizes larger to account for shrinkage and to allow for layering. If you only plan to wear a thin tank top underneath, you probably don't need to size up too much. But if you plan to wear a long sleeve thermal underneath and still want a loose fit, I'd go up 2 sizes. MORE SPECIFIC DETAILS: This sweatshirt is between light-weight and mid-weight thickness. It's more suitable to wear during chilly/cooler days in the Fall or Spring. It's not enough to keep someone warm during very cold Winter weather without adding several layers underneath and on top. I wore both sweatshirts twice before washing them. Once with only a tank top underneath, and once with a thin long sleeve thermal underneath. Then I machine washed them in semi-warm water and dried them on medium heat (being careful not to leave them in the dryer more than necessary). BEFORE LAUNDERING: Both sweatshirts felt slightly rough (nothing really bothersome or too noticeable) and disappointingly thin. The color was as expected - a lovely muted, pale green. One sweatshirt arrived with excess threads hanging from the bottom. But I was able to safely cut them off without risk of anything unraveling. I liked the way both tops fit and draped. The sizes were as I hoped they would be. I accidentally spilled a cold, milky coffee drink on the smaller sweatshirt. I treated it with a pre-wash stain remover. Then threw both sweatshirts in the washer with a pair of jeans and no-lint sports towel (all similar colors as the sweatshirts). AFTER LAUNDERING: Both tops became softer and slightly fluffier after washing. This made them feel a bit thicker and warmer. Both were noticably smaller, though. The large top now fits similar to the way the medium used to fit. Except it's a tad bit shorter. Both tops no longer drape the way they did before I washed them. It's not a huge issue for me, though. The banding on both tops also shrank a bit. I no longer like the way the medium fits me. Prior to washing, the end of the sleeves reached halfway down my fingers. The sleeve cuffs were loose enough that I could have them drape that way, but just snug enough that I could pull them back around my wrists. Now the wrist cuffs sit snuggly around my wrists. When I reach for items above my head, the sleeves pull back a bit, exposing more of my wrists... and the waist hem rides up so that I have to yank it down when I drop my arms back down to my sides. (That's how badly the top shrank in length after just one wash!) The brown color from where I spilled my coffee on the medium top was gone, but there's still a visible stain. It just looks a couple shades darker than the sweatshirt color... like I spilled water on myself and it's starting to dry a bit. (I'm going to try a different stain remover and wash it again. Hopefully it works, otherwise this top will permanently look dirty.) As I already mentioned, the larger top had some pale pumkin-yellow spots on the lower banding - similar to what bleach spots would look like. I'm okay with the fit of the larger size sweatshirt even after it shrank. So, it's a shame that the color bled the way it did. Overall, I'm disappointed with my purchases. These are already going to be dedicated lounging and housework shirts. They are a bit warmer and very soft inside, which is nice. And nothing has unraveled, so it seems the stitching is good. I don't think these would be great for screen-printing, simply because of the amount of shrinkage and the fact that they're already showing signs of pilling in areas that don't get much friction. Hope this info helps. If anything, these aren't bad sweatshirts to have on hand to adapt to temperature fluctuations. They're stretchy, so they're easy to quickly throw on as an extra layer and take off as needed. Just be mindful they leave some lint behind on 100% cotton shirts. The lint problem will probably diminish after a few washes, though.

label: Mens_Clothing
review_title: Impressive and affordable "retro-classic" polo sweater shirt!
review_text: I like the quality, performance and versatility of this sophisticated looking polo style sweater-shirt. The soft, breathable, 100% Viscose fabric is flattering, and tailored to fit perfectly in all the right places. I typically order a size medium polo, but I decided to size down to a small for a more form fitting, "athletic fit". I'm glad I did because it fits great (see photo). I would suggest ordering your standard t-shirt or golf shirt size, if you plan on wearing a shirt underneath. This fun, retro-classic sweater-shirt does have an "old money" look and feel. Something I would imagine Rock Hudson wearing on a Hollywood movie set back in the 1950's, but a trendy guy in his 20's or 30's can also rock this shirt! This is a classy, versatile button down to have in your wardrobe, and a good value for the money. Highly recommended!

Style & Versatility: They‚Äôre simple, clean-looking shirts that you can wear not only to the gym but also for casual everyday wear. The variety of colors in the pack is a nice touch, so you‚Äôre not always stuck with the same shirt. Overall: If you‚Äôre looking for affordable, comfortable, and reliable long sleeve athletic shirts, this pack is an easy win. Great for workouts, layering, or just lounging around. Highly recommend!

label: Mens_Clothing
review_text: I was looking for new flannel shirts that wouldn't break the bank and saw some recommendations for this brand. It arrived the next day and, frankly, I was disappointed. I ordered a Large, but this felt like XL or maybe even XXL. Additionally, the flannel didn't feel soft at all. In reading reviews, I saw many that mentioned how much they shrink, so I decided to chance it and wash on hot (recommendation was to wash cold). After washing and drying, the fit was absolutely PERFECT and the fabric was much softer. I really like the overall quality. The corduroy lining along the neck and cuffs makes it look really sharp. Quality buttons and stitching. The color combination was excellent. Not sure if Amazon allows mention of other brands, so I'll just say I compared it with flannel shirts that are twice as expensive. Legendary Whitetails is a bit heavier, but that's probably due to the corduroy. The flannel fabric is on par with the others in terms of thickness, which is to say, not as thick as I had hoped for, but still very good. Overall, I think this is a great value and I immediately purchased more shirts.
author: Richard N.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2025

label: Mens_Clothing
review_title: Great big and tall shirt for a big and tall dude
review_text: Absolutely terrific shirts! I‚Äôm 6‚Äô6‚Äù, 320 lbs., with broad shoulders. It can be difficult to find clothes that are quality, look good, fit well, and reasonably priced. This shirt hits on all points! Immediately I tried it on. I noticed two awesome things right away: the softness of the material and the button placement. Many button down shirts these days leave a lot of fabric at the bottom where just one more button is be necessary for us tall folks. Otherwise the shirt stays tucked in but it also separates revealing one‚Äôs hairy belly button. Yikes! Cost cutting over customer satisfaction (I‚Äôm looking at you, Men‚Äôs Wearhouse). This shirt had that necessary button. The thickness of the shirt is excellent as well; nice for indoor wear. And the sleeves are long; no getting short changed here. Next came the laundry test. Many flannel shirts come out of a washing either shrunk, heavily wrinkled, or both. The shirt then looks ‚Äúoff‚Äù no matter what you try. This shirt (and two others I bought) came out true to size and wrinkled only slightly! I don‚Äôt own a dryer (dryers are a product of a secret society in cahoots with electric companies) so I hang dried the shirt, and it looks great! A quick steam, and it‚Äôs ready to wear. The corduroy on the collar and cuffs is a nice touch also, especially with the cuffs to add weight to the sleeves. Overall, these are my new favorites. I‚Äôve bought three others to add to the three I‚Äôve already purchased. With a large variety in colors, I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôll purchase more. One tiny issue with this shirt: on the tip of one collar the pattern stopped in the white. See picture. It‚Äôs very small and won‚Äôt bother me in the slightest. But if my family notices it, they will be unrelenting in their jokes and jabs. It is what it is. :))

I'm just a regular man that works and wants to stay warm without buying big name brands or fancy clothes and I got a say Carhartt never fails like never. The jacket is so nice, so warm, so snug, the most perfect front pocket for a jacket I've ever had on a jacket/pullover in my life. I lack buying clothes much so I like to think one jacket will be good for all occasions and this is the one!!! If you're thinking about it, just do it. I can promise you will be very happy with the purchase and it didn't break the bank. I think very reasonably priced, shoot ida spent an extra 20$ if need be I like it that much. Perfect for work, perfect for just being cozy and chillin on the couch, perfect to wear even on your special day!! This jacket, you could bury me in it so be it!! Great job Carhartt!!

I decided to get this one because the reviews were good and it is a good price as well. It's safe to say that this is a great jacket for the price. I am 5'2 and I wanted the jacket to fit a bit bigger on me. I got a small and it reaches mid thigh which is perfect for me. It's very comfy and lightweight, seems to be good material. The pockets are a good size, my iPhone 12 pro max fits comfortably in them even though it is a pretty big phone. The only thing I would say is that the zipper doesn't feel the best, not necessarily bad though. It is not very smooth, but it's not something that would bother me very much.

review_text: This bomber jacket in medium fits me perfectly. The body and arm length are just right, not too tight or too loose. It's a sharp, modern look that works great for casual nights or everyday wear. I like it so much, I got a black one too. I received the black jacket with a faulty zipper and loose threads but I was able to return it and get a replacement. Even with that minor hiccup, I wouldn't deduct any stars since it's still a great jacket for the price and style. It is definitely best suited for fall and spring weather - it's lightweight and comfortable but not meant for colder days. Overall, a great value $$ and stylish addition to the wardrobe.

label: Mens_Clothing
review_title: The Perfect Blend of Style and Serenity: RANKEEF Tiger Eye Bracelet Review
review_text: In the ever-evolving world of men's accessories, finding pieces that strike the perfect balance between style and comfort can be a challenge. However, my quest for such a piece ended when I discovered the RANKEEF Tiger Eye Bracelet. This bracelet, with its 8MM natural stone beads and stretch lava rock, has quickly become an indispensable part of my daily wear. Here's why it stands out. First and foremost, the comfort of this bracelet is unparalleled. The elastic band ensures a snug fit without being too tight, allowing for all-day wear without any discomfort. Whether I'm typing away at work, enjoying a casual outing, or engaging in light physical activity, this bracelet remains perfectly comfortable on my wrist. It's a testament to the thoughtful design and quality materials used by RANKEEF. The style aspect of the Tiger Eye Bracelet is equally impressive. The natural stone beads exude a rugged yet refined elegance, making it an accessory that complements a wide range of outfits. From casual tees and jeans to more formal wear, this bracelet adds a touch of sophistication without ever feeling out of place. The tiger eye stones, known for their captivating appearance and perceived properties of bringing luck and protection, are paired with lava rock beads, adding an interesting textural contrast and visual appeal. Beyond its aesthetics, there's a certain charm to wearing a bracelet made from natural elements. The tiger eye and lava rock beads are not just visually appealing; they carry a sense of earthiness and grounding. Whether or not one subscribes to the belief in the healing properties of natural stones, there's an undeniable comfort in carrying a piece of nature with you. It serves as a subtle reminder of the world's natural beauty and complexity. Another aspect worth mentioning is the versatility of the RANKEEF Tiger Eye Bracelet. Its design is such that it can be worn alone as a statement piece or paired with other bracelets for a more layered look. This versatility makes it an excellent choice for those looking to experiment with their style or simply add a versatile piece to their accessory collection. In conclusion, the RANKEEF Tiger Eye Bracelet is a remarkable accessory for men. It combines style, comfort, and a touch of natural elegance in a way that few other pieces can. Whether you're dressing up for a special occasion or simply looking for a stylish addition to your everyday wear, this bracelet is sure to impress. Its quality, design, and the positive vibe it brings make it a must-have for any man looking to enhance his accessory game.

label: Footwear
review_title: Comfy and fashionable alternative to the Samba and Gazelle
review_text: I am so happy with these sneakers! I find both the Sambas and Gazelles to be a little too narrow and have too low of a profile to be comfortable (I have a pretty high instep). However, these Court Sneakers have a similar look but have a wider more stable base and they are super comfortable right out of the box! This is actually my second pair-my first pair where blue suede, which I also love. The white is like a pebbled leather with white suede toe and heel tab. The sole is gum rubber and the insides is cushioned, though not as cushioned as a typical running shoe, this shoe is ALMOST that comfy. It has a low to moderate amount of arch support, which I expect with a more fashionable sneaker (I won't be running any 5Ks is these). I usually wear a size 7 1/2 W in a running shoe, and the 7's fit great in this shoe with enough height for my high instep and enough room in the toe box so it doesn't scrunch my toes together. What I find even more attractive is the price. Many of my fashion sneakers are ridiculously expensive and these are a fraction of the cost making it much more cost effective to get them in a number of colors.

review_text: I‚Äôve been wearing the Adidas Lite Racer Adapt 7.0 for a while now, and honestly, they‚Äôre one of the most comfortable shoes I‚Äôve owned. The fit is spot on ‚Äî snug but not tight ‚Äî and the slip-on design makes it super easy to get them on and off. No messing with laces, which I love. They feel really light on my feet, almost like I‚Äôm not even wearing shoes. For running on the road, they‚Äôve been great. label: Footwear
review_title: Run a bit small and have to be broken, but a great value and worth it.
review_text: These are a great value. I have always been an active person and would spend $100+ on running shoes I would beat into the ground. After some health issues I recently got back into an active lifestyle, but didn‚Äôt want to spend too much on a pair of shoes I was going to destroy. I picked these specifically because they were easy to slip on and off and wouldn‚Äôt need to worry about the laces constantly coming undone. They look great and the cushioning is good. I will say that it took a few weeks of daily wear to break them in and at first thought I may have to return them because they were hurting my feet. Once I wore them for a while and stretched them out, because they do run a bit small, they are incredibly comfortable and I use them everyday to walk at least two miles as well as play about an hour or so of recreational basketball. I am satisfied with this purchase, just be prepared to really have to break them in for a little while.

Pros: Very comfortable right out of the box Stylish, clean look Easy slip-on design (no laces to deal with) Great for casual, everyday wear Cons: Not designed for repeated athletic use Mesh sides wore out quickly under heavy activity Toes started sticking out after a few months Not suitable for sports like pickleball Overall Verdict: These sneakers are excellent as casual, everyday shoes, but they‚Äôre not meant for intense or repetitive athletic use. label: Footwear
review_title: Comfy and fashionable alternative to the Samba and Gazelle
review_text: I am so happy with these sneakers! I find both the Sambas and Gazelles to be a little too narrow and have too low of a profile to be comfortable (I have a pretty high instep). However, these Court Sneakers have a similar look but have a wider more stable base and they are super comfortable right out of the box! This is actually my second pair-my first pair where blue suede, which I also love. The white is like a pebbled leather with white suede toe and heel tab. The sole is gum rubber and the insides is cushioned, though not as cushioned as a typical running shoe, this shoe is ALMOST that comfy. It has a low to moderate amount of arch support, which I expect with a more fashionable sneaker (I won't be running any 5Ks is these). I usually wear a size 7 1/2 W in a running shoe, and the 7's fit great in this shoe with enough height for my high instep and enough room in the toe box so it doesn't scrunch my toes together. What I find even more attractive is the price. Many of my fashion sneakers are ridiculously expensive and these are a fraction of the cost making it much more cost effective to get them in a number of colors.

I picked these specifically because they were easy to slip on and off and wouldn‚Äôt need to worry about the laces constantly coming undone. They look great and the cushioning is good. I will say that it took a few weeks of daily wear to break them in and at first thought I may have to return them because they were hurting my feet. Once I wore them for a while and stretched them out, because they do run a bit small, they are incredibly comfortable and I use them everyday to walk at least two miles as well as play about an hour or so of recreational basketball. I am satisfied with this purchase, just be prepared to really have to break them in for a little while.

It layers great with my other products, and I‚Äôve had zero irritation. If you have dry skin, this is honestly such a perfect moisturizer. It‚Äôs hydrating, comfortable, and gives that dewy, bouncy finish. I‚Äôm definitely buying it again!
author: C
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2025

label: Beauty_Personal_Care
review_text: This was my first time using this Medicube product & I like it. It is on the heavier side & upon application, a bit sticky. However, like all skin prep products, letting it settle before applying other products is key. The stickiness goes away upon absorption by the skin. I'm inclined to use it at night or if during the day, without makeup, just sunscreen. It's weight is a bit much during the day (for me) if you like using foundation, contour, blush, powder, etc. I personally don't like layering a ton of makeup during the day - moisturizers or sunscreen, that's it. I don't find primers do much unless I'm going for the full coverage look, which is not often. I will pamper my face at night, though, and if my face looks like a glazed doughnut before I go to bed, it's happy. It has a very soothing & mosturizing feel to it, more so than some higher-end products I use. My skin is relatively dry (and mature) - the soft feel continues much longer than many products. I think this is a very good value for the money. I use Retin-A every 3 months to force a gentle peel & this feels awesome on my face when it shedding & sensitive. Nice travel size, texture & consistency. I would definitely recommend trying this if you like products with nacinamide & collagen.

review_title: Absolutely amazing!  Sold on the results!!

I have tried SO MANY PRODUCTS. Clinique, Drunk Elephant, various drug store brands, and nothing really made a difference at all. This Medicube Collagen Jelly is AMAZING. My skin looks better after just 3 weeks of use than it has in years. My skin feels plump and healthy. I don‚Äôt wake up with bags under my eyes, and my turkey neck has been minimized. This even helps my hooded eyelids, when I apply it there. (I know it‚Äôs not recommend to use close to the eyes but so far I‚Äôve had no issues when I use it on my eyelids). I know some folks don‚Äôt like the sticky texture but I only have that issue if I use too much when I apply it. I start with a small amount and build up to the amount I need. Then I put my regular moisturizer on top of it. Not only is this stuff a miracle in a jar, it‚Äôs affordable!! I am SOLD on this product with the results I‚Äôve seen. I‚Äôm so glad I took a chance on it!!

review_text: Worked surprisingly well. I have allergies so I have a lot of issues with my eyes. I could tell a difference after one use but like most products, it's not a permanent result. The gold ones definitely have helped the most and arw the thickest ones in the box. The blue ones are thinner so if you aren't gentle they can tear. Overall I'd say they're fairly durable considering what they are used for. They do hydrate well and fit perfectly under the eye. I didn't have any issues with them sliding or falling off once in place. I was able to move around while it absorbed into my skin. It dries pretty quickly leaving my skin smooth and moisturized after removing. I would buy again. My eye bags are so much better now, My fark cicrles are gone and my wrinkles have significantly improved. I would recommend giving these a try if you're a lowcost product that gives good results.

label: Beauty_Personal_Care
review_text: I think this might be my new holy grail moisturizer. Before then, I used one of those urea/aha based exfoliating lotions that despite moisturizing capabilities didn't hold up in a dry home. Enters Eos, after a browsing reddit beauty post. Why it's my HG: It's non-greasy consistency for one, absorbs fast and it leaves you soft and moisturized for hours. It's not tacky, goopy and gross which is a sensory ick to me. The scent is not in your face strong or cloying, but like buttery vanilla frosting, and it's a lasting scent for something that light. It's still on my nightgown, and I'm sure if I had a guy, he'd probably want to smell my skin every time. Lastly it's good quality for the price point, but I'm a little biased since I loved their lip balms in the little orb, I figured it couldn't hurt. It was a toss up between this and Nivea but IIRC they were about $11 vs $8 and some change for Eos 16oz. I'm indulgent, but frugal, so this won out in the end. Only drawback, the bottle doesn't stand, but again for what it's offering I can just prop it up against other things.

label: Beauty_Personal_Care
review_title: Smells like Pistachio Ice Cream and.....Pennies?
review_text: The formulation of this lotion is really really good--just the ideal balance of richness and quick absorption. It's a generous size for the price, the bottle is nicely designed, and it really adds moisture to my dry arms and legs. I like it so much I'm using it daily despite the scent being....confusing. At first sniff, on my skin, this smells EXACTLY like pistachio gelato tastes. Creamy, smooth, not too sweet. Then there's a faint metallic tang. It's a fragrance, overall, that I can't say I mind, but it's probably not something I would usually choose to smell like. I was expecting a less literal interpretation of "creme de pistachio", I guess, but it smells like what it says on the tin. And faintly, like the tin itself. It is a light fragrance, but it really hangs in there for many, many hours. I've had several people sniff this and they have all come away looking perplexed. It could be my body chemistry adding the metallic note. Scents tend to pull soapy on me, but this is a new one. Idk. I get why this is a cult favorite. I will use this bottle up, mostly at night, and probably buy it again in another scent.

label: Security_Surveillance
review_title: Nice pet camera, easy set up and good value
review_text: The TP-Link Tapo camera works great as a pet camera and it‚Äôs an excellent value for the price. This camera was super easy to set up and has all the features I need to check in on my pets when I am sat work or away from home. Picture quality is good and the field of vision adequate, and with the panning feature it is easy to look into different areas of a room. You can pan side to side at least 180 degrees as well as up and down to a certain degree. The camera plus into a wall outlet so there is no concern over battery life. I have another security camera that I use in another area of the house that is rechargeable which is great for an area that isn‚Äôt close to a power outlet but you always have to worry about battery life and recharging. No concern with this one. As with other security camera you can set up alerts for motion and it has other features. One feature I like is being able to use a SD card to store pictures and videos rather than use a cloud account although you still have that option for a price. Picture quality is good, the only issue I‚Äôve experienced is when the camera is pointed to a window which makes the picture much darker trying to adjust to the bright light. Other than that it‚Äôs worked great for me.

author: NSF*

label: Security_Surveillance
review_title: Cat Cam with Great Features at an Unbeatable Price
review_text: I was looking for a second cat camera to monitor our cats when we‚Äôre away from home, with specific needs: two-way audio, local and cloud recording, motion detection with alerts, and clear video with night vision. The TP-Link Tapo Pan/Tilt Security Camera, on sale for just $19, checked all my boxes and exceeded expectations with some unexpected bonuses. Here‚Äôs my experience to help you decide if this camera is right for you. Performance and Features The 1080P video is sharp and clear, providing enough detail to see what my cats are up to, even in low light thanks to the reliable night vision. The pan/tilt feature allows me to cover a wide area of the room, and the motion detection works flawlessly, sending alerts to my phone and triggering house lights when set up. The two-way audio is a fun bonus‚ÄîI tested it and startled my cats by speaking through the camera when I wasn‚Äôt in the room! My wife loves that we can share video clips easily through the app, which adds a nice touch for capturing cute moments. Setup and Integration Setup was a breeze, and I was thrilled to find that the Tapo app automatically integrated with my existing Kasa app, adding the camera to my master device list without any extra effort. It works seamlessly with both Alexa and Google Home, allowing voice commands and linking motion alerts to control smart lights in the house. I inserted a 128GB Class 10 micro-SD card for local recording, which provides up to 16 days of continuous storage, and I also set up cloud recording for added peace of mind. Both recording options work perfectly for my needs. Verdict At $19, this camera is an absolute steal for a pet or baby monitor. It delivers clear video, reliable motion detection, two-way audio, and night vision, with the added flexibility of local and cloud storage. The seamless integration with the Kasa app, Alexa, and Google Home makes it incredibly user-friendly, and the ability to share clips is a fun perk. Whether you‚Äôre keeping an eye on pets, kids, or your home, this camera offers premium features at a budget-friendly price. I highly recommend it for anyone looking for a versatile, high-quality security camera. Pro Tip: Pair it with a high-capacity micro-SD card (like a 128GB Class 10) for extended local recording, and take advantage of the Alexa/Google Home integration to link motion alerts with smart home devices for added convenience. If you find this useful please mark as Helpful!

author: DAWN CASH
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2025

label: Security_Surveillance
review_text: This product was a great deal! We got an excellent price on it, and it arrived early. It was well packaged and everything was secure with boxes and boxes of cameras, hard-drive and wiring. Install was super easy, since we were replacing our old system. Took my husband approx 1hr and 30 mins to get all the old cameras down (4) and new cameras (5/8) installed. We were able to use the old wires to pull new wiring through. Setup was also super easy, as we have not run this through our wifi. When we go through that process, I will try to update the review with information regarding setup and app installation. Picture quality is great day and night, but the night vision is fairly limited depending on light. The scope of details for the cameras are bright to dim where there is little to no light, covering an estimated 10'W by 30'D area. In well lit areas the distance is much greater with clear picture for up to 150' or more. That is the one negative and would be the one area needing improvement, or there may be another system that offers further coverage at night. The 2T hard-drive is big but not bulky. The system we replaced was only 1T and was about 4 in more narrow from front to back. We chose this system because of the ability to hook 8 cameras up. It also has the capabilities to mix and match so we can use wireless cameras if wanted as well. Since we were going from wired to wired, with the exception of one, we chose to keep the wired cameras instead of buying all new wireless. When we get the 3 wireless I will update the review with that info if able. Setting up the system was as easy as following the prompts. Password protected or not, it is up to you. We chose to go with a wireless mouse of our own rather than use the corded mouse that is included, and it works fine like that. Easy to configure cameras and set them up. The one area that we don't like is viewing options. You can set them up with all 8 on the screen but not just 5, so we have 3 black screens where those are not connected. 1 is displayed larger than the other 7, that are all smaller around 2 sides of the 1 larger. You can also display them 1 at a time that flips from 1 to the next, and if motion occurs it will jump back to the screen and hold there for designated time. There are other options as well if you decide to do the wifi and internet option- you can set alerts to shoot an email and even contact the monitoring app for remote viewing of every alert if necessary. The motion sensitivity can be set to certain areas in a grid or for entire screen and you can have it sensitive enough to alert when a leaf falls 20 yards away during the day or less sensitivity so that it doesn't trigger further than 5ft away. The whole program is really easy to maneuver and the possibilities are endless with this system. Hopefully this review helps. I definitely recommend this product if you want good quality, excellent picture and an easy install, all for a very competitive price.

author: Kristy Davis
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2025

label: Security_Surveillance
review_title: Just as good as the higher-end cameras, but for 1/3 of the price!
review_text: These cameras are great! I have the Eufy indoor camera / baby monitor, but left it at home while traveling. I purchased these as a cheap backup and honestly they work just as well for about 1/3 of the price! Such a great value! These aren't 4K HD or anything, but for what they are, the quality is pretty good! (I've attached pics of day and night so you can see for yourself.) The night vision lets you see pretty clearly even in super dark spaces. I have one in an interior closet with basically zero light, and somehow it still "sees" just fine. The night vision is in black and white rather than color, but I‚Äôm pretty sure that's true of all night vision cameras. The sound quality is also pretty good. It's far louder than you would expect, so it picks up noise very well. The motion detection feature is also nice. You can change the sensitivity so it doesn't pick up every little rustle in the room. You can also set it to differentiate between random movement and actual humans. I have one of the Tapo stationary cameras in my cat's LitterRobot (I know that's gross, please don't judge me. My cat had a urinary blockage and almost died so now I have to make sure he uses the box at normal intervals ü´£ ) and this helps differentiate if there's a cat in the box or it it's just the robot cycling. I guess that's not the most glowing review if the camera algorithm mixes up a cat and a human... but for my purposes, I appreciate it. Mountability: I don't have my cameras mounted, so I can't tell you how easy it is personally, but I did look into the mounts when I was deciding where I wanted to put them, and they look pretty fool-proof to set up. Overall, it's so worth it. I'd definitely buy these again.

review_title: Excellent Camera - Outstanding Performance and Reliability!
review_text: Excellent Camera - Outstanding Performance and Reliability! I've been using this TP-Link Tapo C500 for several weeks now, and I'm thoroughly impressed with its performance. This camera has truly exceeded my expectations in every way. The 360¬∞ pan/tilt functionality is seamless and responsive, giving me complete visibility around my outdoor space. The 1080P resolution is crystal clear, making it easy to identify details even from a distance. The motion tracking feature works flawlessly‚Äîit automatically follows movement and captures exactly what I need to see. The night vision is outstanding. I was skeptical at first, but the infrared capability delivers sharp, detailed footage even in complete darkness. The AI detection features are remarkably accurate, effectively filtering out false alerts and only notifying me when it matters. Setup was incredibly straightforward, and the integration with both Alexa and Google Home adds wonderful convenience to my smart home system. I love being able to check my camera feed from anywhere using the app, and the cloud and SD card storage options give me peace of mind knowing my footage is secure. Reliability has been exceptional‚Äîthis camera has performed flawlessly in various weather conditions, with no hiccups. The build quality feels solid and well-designed for outdoor use. I highly recommend this camera to anyone looking for a dependable, high-quality security solution. It's a fantastic investment that delivers real value. If you're on the fence, don't hesitate‚Äîthis camera is absolutely worth it! Five stars, all the way!

The photo below is a screenshot from 4:55 a.m. The camera will pan 180¬∞, I can see the far left end of my property and my right neighbors entire property. The pan will stay where you leave it, so be sure it' where you want it. You can also put it on surveillance mode, where it scans left to right by itself nonstop. The app is a breeze to use, and it stores clips of all activity. It can differentiate between a person and a vehicle, etc. I do have the Tapo premium subscription at $3.49 a month, which is a great price. I am beyond satisfied with this camera now that it's working properly.

author: Anonymous
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2025

label: Security_Surveillance
review_title: Reliable and versatile indoor security solution
review_text: The Kasa Smart 2023 New Indoor Pan-Tilt Security Camera (EC71) is a versatile and feature-rich security solution for monitoring your home, pets, and babies. With its 1080p HD video quality, night vision, motion detection, and compatibility with Alexa and Google Home, it offers a comprehensive security package. Its ability to pan and tilt provides extensive coverage, and options for both local and cloud storage add to its flexibility. Key Features: 1. 360¬∞ Pan/Tilt Field of View: - The camera's 360¬∞ horizontal and 113¬∞ vertical range allows you to monitor an entire room or walkway. The Patrol Mode feature lets you set intervals to monitor different regions automatically. 2. Motion Tracking: - The camera can automatically track moving objects or people, providing real-time alerts to enhance your security system's effectiveness. 3. Detection & Instant Notification: - Get push notifications when motion or a person is detected. You can also enable baby crying detection, making it suitable as a baby monitor. Notifications help you discern important events from everyday activities. 4. 2-Way Audio with Built-In Siren: - The 2-way audio feature allows you to communicate with pets or family members remotely. The built-in siren can deter intruders, enhancing home security. 5. Secure Local or Cloud Storage: - Save footage on a microSD card (up to 256 GB, not included) or subscribe to Kasa Care for cloud storage with a 30-day video history and additional features like Video Summary and Activity Notifications with Snapshots. 6. Night Vision up to 30 Ft.: - The integrated IR system provides clear night vision up to 30 feet, ensuring you don‚Äôt miss any activity in low-light conditions. 7. 1080P Full HD Video: - Capture detailed 1080p Full HD video, making it easy to see small details like what your baby is holding or what your pet is playing with. 8. Works with Alexa & Google Home: - Compatible with Amazon Alexa and Google Home, you can use voice commands to view live streams on devices like Echo Show or Google Chromecast. Pros: - Extensive Coverage: The 360¬∞ pan and 113¬∞ tilt provide comprehensive room coverage. - Versatile Monitoring: Suitable for home security, pet monitoring, and baby monitoring. - Real-Time Alerts: Instant notifications for motion, people, and baby crying. - 2-Way Communication: Interact with pets or family members remotely. - Multiple Storage Options: Choose between local microSD storage and cloud storage with Kasa Care. - Clear Night Vision: Up to 30 feet of night vision ensures you don‚Äôt miss activity in the dark. - High-Definition Video: 1080p HD video for clear and detailed footage. - Smart Home Integration: Works seamlessly with Alexa and Google Home. Cons: - Occasional Slow Response: Some users report that the camera can be slow to respond at times. - SD Card Not Included: The microSD card for local storage is not included, which requires an additional purchase. - Subscription Cost: Accessing full cloud storage features requires a subscription to Kasa Care. Conclusion: The Kasa Smart 2023 New Indoor Pan-Tilt Security Camera (EC71) is a highly functional and flexible security solution for any home. Its wide range of features, including motion tracking, 2-way audio, night vision, and compatibility with smart home devices, make it a standout choice. While there may be occasional slow response times, the overall performance and ease of use make it a worthwhile investment for enhancing your home security. Recommendation: I highly recommend this camera to anyone in need of a reliable and versatile indoor security solution. Its extensive features, coupled with high-definition video quality and smart home integration, provide excellent value for the price. Whether you're monitoring pets, babies, or general home security, this camera is a robust and user-friendly choice.

review_text: These cameras are such a great deal! They are advertised as 2k resolution, but they are much lower. However this is fine, as the quality is still great for a security camera and the smaller size realistically means less data written to your microSD card if you are using local storage. I can still see everything with great detail. The pan and tilt features work great and it has motion tracking, although I personally leave them static and focused on a single location. It comes with a mounting bracket and you can invert the camera in the app, so you can mount it upside down if you want to attach it to a ceiling. I got these mainly for use at night. The built-in infrared lighting for night vision is powerful for such a small camera. It lights up everything in frame, although I am using them indoors, so the viewing distance is no more than 30ft in the biggest room of the house. Still, I see everything clearly. It also has the option to disable IR in case you prefer color, but this will come at a cost of less detail, as the sensor may not have enough light to light everything up. You can also select a mode to have it use night vision, but diable its own infrared light, incase you are using a separate external infrared light. I don't think you would need an additional infrared light unless you were planning to use this outside and over a larger distance. Overall, really happy with these cameras for the price. They definitely give more peace of mind and make the home feel more secure. If you are planning to get these, I'd recommend ordering some microSD cards and using local storage so that you dont have to pay for cloud service. Their cloud service plans for what they offer are pricey, and aren't worth it IMO, but to others they might be.

label: Security_Surveillance
review_title: Fully featured cameras without the subscription.
review_text: These are great cameras! Easy to install and set up, no subscription required, and they have been up fivemonths without problem. The solar panels seem to charge them very effectively, only needing to charge about every three days, and you can track that through the app very easily. These have pretty much every feature you could want in a home security camera. The one feature I wish they did have ( and could probably be added later through firmware update, hint hint Eufy) is the ability to have the cameras scan an area regularly. You can set a default position and multiple additional views in the app, but have to switch between them manually. It is great that I can view recorded clips and live footage from anywhere very easily and everything is stored locally at my home with no subscription. AI features are good and constantly improving as well.
author: Shawn W
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2025

label: Security_Surveillance
review_title: Perfect Solar-Powered Camera for Simple Home Security
review_text: This is the second security camera I've purchased, and it's a significant upgrade! My first experience was with a Blink camera, which was a decent entry-level option, but the monthly fees were a downside. What I immediately loved about this camera is that it doesn't require any monthly subscription. I've always been intrigued by 360 cameras but wasn't sure which one to choose. When this one popped up as a Black Friday deal, I jumped at the chance, and I'm so glad I did. The installation was straightforward, with easy-to-follow instructions. It connects to Wi-Fi effortlessly, making setup a breeze. I had it professionally mounted on the side of my house, and the image quality is excellent. The audio is also clear, making it a high-quality camera overall. The fact that there's no mandatory monthly fee is a huge plus, though there's an option to upgrade if desired. Video storage is handled locally on the camera. It's important to note that motion detection recordings, such as people approaching or cars stopping by, are automatically deleted after 24 hours. While you can purchase additional storage if you need to keep videos longer, I personally find the 24-hour storage sufficient for my needs. I'm comfortable with the videos disappearing unless there's a specific recording I want to save or download. For those seeking a simple, reliable camera to monitor their front door or home, I highly recommend this one. The solar panel feature is a game-changer. No need to worry about changing batteries or complicated wiring, as it charges itself continuously.

Installing the wireless was easy, just had to used an extension ladder two of the cameras. All the cameras work great as well as the clarity of the pictures from the cameras. Great product!!! label: Security_Surveillance
review_title: Pretty Good PTZ Solar Security Cameras
review_text: These cameras are pretty good. Good clarity, good tracking, not too sensitive or lacking sensitivity. Picks up wildlife around my property when I have animal detection turned on. Human tracking is ideal. I do recommend following the installation instructions and mount the camera(s) so they detect at an angle. Head on monitoring doesn't always pick up a person approaching the house. Easy setup and if you need a larger amount of storage, purchase the Home Base. Battery life is good. The solar panels recharge the batteries well. The only downfall I have found is that when viewing Live View, there is an annoying pop-up every couple of minutes causing you to either keep live view going or cancel live viewing. I rely heavily on live view and I monitor my battery level so I don't need a pop-up that cancels the live view if you don't choose to continue it. I have sent a suggestion to the manufacturer explaining my issue. I think (I'm no pro at how this all works) it may just be a programming change in software (app). We'll see. Anyway, aside from that, I would recommend the to someone looking for good PTZ, solar charged security cameras.

I will return to update this review after HP figures this out and figures out how to compensate me for the badly printed pages.

label: Office_Printer_Supplies
review_title: Perfect printer for at home use!
review_text: Perfect affordable printer for at home use! It was super easy to set up. HP support has a video on their YouTube channel of how to set it up, and it was really straight forward. After you take off the tape and plastic liners, it has you download the HP app and the app guides you through setting up the WiFi, paper, & ink. Overall from unboxing to printing my first sheet, it probably took about 15-20 minutes. Setting up my WiFi and connecting to my phone was a breeze. I don‚Äôt have a computer so I was worried about finding a printer that could easily print from my phone, but this was very simple and easy to do. I was able to print documents directly from my files, as well as photos from my photo app. It takes a little less than 30 seconds per sheet, which isn‚Äôt bad for an at home printer, but could be slightly irritating if you‚Äôre printing over 50 pages at a time. The ink is great, prints pretty true to color. The black is saturated, and the colored ink is slightly less vibrant but that‚Äôs not an issue for me personally. I added a photo of what it looks like printing via the HP app, as well as the printed page afterwards. As you can see, the black is nice and saturated, the red is slightly less saturated but nothing bad, and it prints very accurately. This is perfect for my homeschooling needs, & for less than $40 I‚Äôm very happy with it. Pros : - printer and copy machine in one - comes with ink both black and colored - black ink is nice and saturated - an additional 3 month free trial to their ink subscription - after the trial the ink subscription isn‚Äôt very expensive either which is great. - 1 year warranty included - affordable printer (bought on sale for $35) - set up took less than 20 minutes start to finish - prints fast enough for at home use - can print straight from my phone, either from files or photo library Cons : - colored ink is slightly dull, but not too bad as long as you‚Äôre not printing actual photos. - the print speed could be an issue for you if you‚Äôre printing over 50 pages at a time
