label: Office_Printer_Supplies
review_title: A great inexpensive little printer, scanner, copier all in one quiet compact unit
review_text: I purchased the HP Desktop Printer for home use, primarily for assistance when writing Amazon product reviews and it has proved invaluable for keeping my paperwork organized. After several weeks of use I‚Äôm satisfied with its performance. It works as expected and has greatly improved my daily routine. Setup took just minutes, the instructions were clear and everything connected immediately. No user manual was included but YouTube videos helped with any questions I had. It prints, scans and copies efficiently all in one quiet compact unit. Unlike other printers I‚Äôve used in the past, I haven‚Äôt had a problem losing Wi-Fi connection and the print speed is extremely fast with the ability to print right from my computer, tablet or phone. I did read it only supports 2.4GHz WiFi networks so keep that in mind before you purchase. The ink supply that was included is holding up well even after extensive use and the cartridges were easy to install. Since I will primarily be printing in black and white I like the fact that I can print in single cartridge mode, which means I will only have to buy black ink cartridges. The print quality is not the best but acceptable for my purposes. The paper tray feels solid and doesn‚Äôt jam. I plan to download the HP Smart App soon. The product exceeded my expectations in terms of quality. It was well packaged, durable, the design both functional, space saving and attractive. At a price of just $38.89, this Amazon limited time deal offered exceptional value compared to similar products. It arrived in great condition and on time. Highly recommended.
author: Eva Huet
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2025

label: Office_Printer_Supplies
review_title: Solid All-in-One Printer with Great Wireless Features
review_text: I've been using the HP DeskJet 2827e for about two months now, and overall, I'm quite satisfied with this printer. The setup process was straightforward - I had it connected to my WiFi and printing from my phone within 15 minutes. The wireless printing capability is excellent. I can easily print from multiple devices including my laptop, tablet, and smartphone without any connection issues. The HP Smart app makes it simple to manage print jobs, check ink levels, and even scan documents directly to my phone. Print quality is solid for everyday documents and casual photo printing. Text comes out crisp and clear, and colors are reasonably accurate for home use. The scanner works well too, producing clean scans suitable for digital archiving and email attachments. However, there are a couple of drawbacks worth mentioning. First, the printing speed is somewhat slow compared to higher-end models - it's not a problem for occasional printing but could be frustrating if you're printing large documents regularly. Second, like most inkjet printers, the ink cartridges don't last as long as I'd hoped, especially if you print in color frequently. The HP Instant Ink subscription helps manage costs, but it's an additional ongoing expense. Despite these minor issues, this printer offers great value for home users who need basic printing, scanning, and copying capabilities with wireless convenience. It's compact, relatively quiet, and does exactly what most people need without breaking the bank.

author: Kathryn Sooyeon Jang
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2025

label: Networking_Devices
review_text: I wanted a more secure WiFi router while also saving money on the rental from my cable provider, so I was suggested to purchase this by a very experienced tech and cyber security wiz. Now, I personally don't feel that I know much about anything technical these days, but I have really enjoyed this so far. Performance wise, but more than anything I REALLY love the security of the back-office type of controls the TP-Link gives you. PERFORMANCE Now, my current home is 1500 sq ft and a split level home, so most of the areas I use WiFi at home are never too far from the router. I placed the router right on the TV stand underneath the TV so that certainly is as close as it gets. When I'm upstairs (technically 1.5 levels up from the router) I still seem to get fine enough WiFi when I'm browsing on my phone. I will say that the WiFi randomly cuts out for me, but, this is definitely an issue I had with my previous equipment so I don't blame the router itself, it is my provider. Or the wiring outside my house.. not really sure. I have noticed however that when the service does go out, ever since changing to the TP-Link, the service returns much faster and I never have to reset it. With my old provider-provided router, it would be out for hours and I always seemed to have to manually reset the equipment. So in summary, the service and performance for me has been exemplary! SOFTWARE The primary reason I got this was to make sure nobody could hack into my WiFi. With other routers, I am not sure if the same service is available, but this was the first I've ever seen it. Yes... we all know that WiFi is password protected. BUT. Someone can easily hack into it, right? Well not with the TP-Link! You can access the router security through the routers IP address, and you set a password for that as well. The user interface is pretty simple for even a dolt like myself to understand. You can control who can access your WiFi by using a blacklist or a whitelist. A blacklist means that all who have the login details *except* for specific IP addresses you've blocked can access. A whitelist means that ONLY the IP addresses you have added to your list can access the WiFi. I am using the whitelist, since I do not want anyone random or unwanted accessing my service. Let me tell you, it works perfectly! Sometimes I forget that I have this setup, and I have tried many times with many different devices to try and access the wifi... heck, even the guest network, that I thought was specifically setup for this, doesn't seem to let random users access it. It also shows you who is currently accessing it, although I find that feature doesn't seem to be totally accurate sometimes. I give the software 5 stars for the simple fact that it is so easy to control access through it. SUMMARY Overall I am very happy with this purchase. It does what I want it to do, very securely. Setup was a little confusing because if I recall correctly, nobody could access it until we were able to get into the back-office software and setup password first. Other than that I really have had no issues and enjoy using it. When I need to change a setting it is super easy to get in and make any adjustments.
author: UAstudentn
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2022

label: Networking_Devices
review_title: Reliable WiFi 6 performance with real improvements across the whole house.
review_text: The TP-Link AX1800 WiFi 6 Router has been a noticeable upgrade in my home network, and everything here comes from my own experience using it in a fairly device-heavy household. I upgraded from an older WiFi 5 router that had started to struggle, and the improvement with the AX21 has been clear from day one. Setup was simple, but what I liked most was how much control the interface gives without feeling overwhelming. I used the browser setup and adjusted dual-band settings, enabled WPA3, and optimized the channel width in just a few minutes. The interface responds quickly, and making changes does not require constant rebooting or digging through hidden menus. The performance difference with WiFi 6 has been significant. I have multiple smart TVs, computers, phones, and IoT devices, and my previous router would slow down when several things were active at once. The AX21 handles everything smoothly. OFDMA and MU-MIMO keep the network stable even during heavy loads. I‚Äôve streamed 4K content, joined online meetings, and transferred large files all at the same time without interruptions. Coverage has also improved. I tested it with the WiFi Analyzer app for Android, which I‚Äôve used for years to check signal strength and network congestion. In areas where the old router consistently dipped, the AX21 delivered noticeably stronger and more stable readings. In actual use, this translates to fewer drops, steadier speeds, and better performance when moving between rooms. Beamforming makes a difference, especially with mobile devices. The wired connections are equally reliable. I connected my desktop and game console using the gigabit Ethernet ports and ran sustained transfers from a NAS. Speeds stayed at full gigabit with no fluctuations, and the router stayed cool throughout heavy use. Another thing I appreciate is how quietly and efficiently the router runs. It doesn‚Äôt heat up, even when multiple devices are streaming and downloading simultaneously, which says a lot about its hardware design. Based on my experience, the TP-Link AX1800 WiFi 6 Router offers a great balance of real-world performance, strong coverage, and easy configuration. It provides the benefits of WiFi 6 without the overwhelming complexity some high-end models add. For anyone looking for a reliable and technically capable upgrade, this router has been a very solid choice in my home.
author: Kambuko
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2025

label: Networking_Devices
review_text: I really regret not buying this TP-Link AXE5400 Wi-Fi 6E router earlier. The router from my internet provider only had two bands and a limited number of connected devices, which constantly caused issues. After switching to this router, those problems are completely gone. Now all my devices ‚Äî and I have a lot of them ‚Äî work perfectly stable with no random disconnects. I really love the tri-band setup. Smart home devices like cameras and robot vacuums run on the 2.4 GHz band, TVs, PlayStation, and gaming consoles use 5 GHz, and phones and laptops connect to the ultra-fast 6 GHz band. Everything is perfectly balanced and smooth. Setup was fast and easy, coverage is excellent throughout the house, and speeds are impressive on every band. Streaming, gaming, and working online all happen at the same time with zero lag or interruptions. This router has completely upgraded my home network. It‚Äôs powerful, reliable, and absolutely worth it. Highly recommended if you are tired of limitations from basic provider routers and want true Wi-Fi performance.
author: Fredsaw
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2025

label: Networking_Devices
review_text: I needed to replace my aging Netgear Nighthawk router, which didn't provide a great Wi-Fi signal at the outer limits of my home and was no longer eligible to receive firmware updates. After purchasing another a Netgear Mesh router system (and having nothing but constant connectivity issues), I returned that one. I did more research and ended up getting the TP-Link AXE5400. I had the best luck setting it up using the PC/Ethernet connection vs. the Tether phone APP that gave me trouble. The Admin via PC worked slick and I was quickly able to set up my network name & password and automatic firmware upgrades quickly. The router has been in-service for a week with no connectivity issues and great coverage throughout the house and out in the garage (where I couldn't get Wi-Fi with my old router). I can see why this was a PC Mag Editor's choice as this router has performed flawlessly. It's nice to know that this router is ready to add a TP-Link range extender, but with such a strong signal, I doubt I'll ever need it. Way to go TP-Link!
author: Lee B.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2025

label: Networking_Devices
review_text: We have lived in my house for over 10 years. It‚Äôs an older house built in the 60s, There are 6 of us in the house 4 adults, one 13y and one 7y. We have 3 ring devices, 4 Alexa‚Äôs, 6 fire sticks, 6 computers, 6 gaming consoles, a generator, and we all have iPads, cell phones etc, so there are a lot of devices connected to our wifi, so we‚Äôve never had great luck with the range or performance of our internet signal. Things would buffer alot or we‚Äôd have dropped signals, so I was always restarting the router. We use to have Brighthouse but currently have Spectrum with just internet, We upgraded our internet to 1GB over a year ago and was given a dual band wifi 5 router that never really worked for us perfectly, I believe it was because it couldn‚Äôt support 1GB, but didn‚Äôt know that until I got this router. We were using an extender so we could connect to our generator and ring camera that was located outside, and just so you can have an idea, on our generator the wifi signal was at 2%, which was fine but if we wanted to connect anything else outside it was almost impossible. So we contacted customer support about the issues we were having, and they sent us there newest router the wifi 6e router, mind you we were still using the extender. It worked good for a couple days then it stopped. A lot of buffering and a lot of devices wouldn‚Äôt even connect to it like my Oculus Quest 2, my husbands work computer and more! I couldn‚Äôt even connect our ring camera outback, and the generator outside was getting 0%-1% signal, so the signal would drop a lot. I figured it was because a lot of things still aren‚Äôt compatible with wifi 6. So we called support again they did manage to get everything working for about 5 days, then it would stop again. So we called support for the last time and they told us to try to buy a router ourselves. So I happened to come across this one. I was pretty skeptical, thinking it may work as well as the dual band one we had only maybe a little better. The setup process was so easy! Didn‚Äôt have to call Spectrum at all! I do wish that the parental controls, security+ and, QoS was free. But they do give you a free month with any of them. So I did the security+. The app you use with it is great! There are a lot of tools in the settings. You can have it auto connect to a network or set it up separately so you can choose 2.4, 5 or 6G, which is what I did. You can have a guest network, optimize your network performance and a lot more! Everything connected perfectly with excellent signal! So I figured I would try to connect the generator and ring camera outback without the extender just for kicks, since I was feeling optimisticüòé The ring camera connected perfectly with excellent signal! Now was the most important test, the generatorüòµ‚Äçüí´ Connected it for the first time and I see 22% signal!!! I was SOOO excited! Then I went to the farthest part of my backyard with my cell phone where Iv never had wifi signal before and I had 3-4 bars of wifi signal!!! I couldn‚Äôt believe it! This thing has GREAT range, GREAT performance, and is easy to set up and use, what else could you want! It‚Äôs been a couple weeks now, no buffering! and everything works flawlessly! I couldn‚Äôt be happier! No one complaining for me to fix the wifi anymore and no restarting it twice a week! I would definitely recommend this to anyone that has horrible or just ok wifi signal. The only flaw I can say about it is needing a subscription for the extras. Otherwise just go for it! You don‚Äôt like it just return it.
author: Fran
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2023

label: Networking_Devices
review_text: I've never used a router before, so I was honestly a little overwhelmed by all the parts and pieces that come with this. It looked like there was a lot to learn. But after reading through the manual and finding a random 5-minute YouTube video on how to use a router, I got the basics and went ahead and tried it out. And? I think it's great! I was doing tests on a nasty old 2x4, so don't judge the prettiness (or lack thereof) of the work in my photos. Considering it was my first time ever using a router, though, I'm impressed with how well it worked out (and how cleanly it cut). I tried out the round-over bit, going deep to round the edge while leaving a shoulder. And I tried one of the straight bits to plunge in and cut a straight groove. I found the router to be powerful, simple to handle and overall easier to use than I expected. You just pop in your bit, use the 2 wrenches to tighten the collet, adjust your depth and you're good to go (or add the guide first for more precision). My only nitpick is that I think the straight guide could be better. The screw and wing nut that you use to set your distance isn't all the great. But at this price, I'm not complaining. I think it's a bargain.
author: Trixie
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2025

label: Networking_Devices
review_title: Nice fixed base budge palm router kit
review_text: This palm router is better quality than I expected and comes with guides and 6 common router bits making it essentially a ready to use kit. The router bits appear to be more budge quality than higher end bits, but they should work fine for casual use but likely will dull quickly. I unfortunately injured myself so I cannot give them much testing at this time. The bits do come with plastic storage containers that are great for protecting the bit blades from being damaged in storage and will be useful for future replacement bits. There are some features missing that more expensive palm routers will have like variable speed and soft start. Being at full speed, make sure any bits you purchase are rated for at least 35000 rpm. The motor feels like it has plenty of power to handle harder woods or even moderate size bits. This is a fixed depth with the depth adjustment having a metal gear that rides along molded teeth in the plastic body of the router. This may wear faster than if it was metal on metal, but with extra care it shouldn‚Äôt be a real issue anytime soon. This router will come in handy for those uses where getting out my full size router is too much work or when it‚Äôs on my router table. Overall for a casual DIYer or someone just starting to build their shop this is a great value that I hope will last for a long time. Due to an injury I haven‚Äôt been able to test this much, in a couple months I will put this through its paces and will update my review as needed.
author: Seth
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2025

label: Networking_Devices
review_title: Excellent Value and Performance for Woodworking
review_text: This compact router tool is an absolute steal for the price. The 630W, 5.3 Amp motor offers plenty of power for small-to-medium woodworking tasks, and the 35,000 RPM speed makes for a very clean, smooth cut. The fixed base is solid and easy to adjust. I especially appreciated that it came with both the 1/4" collet and a good starter set of 5 trim bits, meaning I could use it right out of the box. The inclusion of the straight and roller guides, along with the extra wrenches and carbon brushes, shows a commitment to providing a complete kit. It's comfortable to handle and a great choice for both beginners and hobbyists looking for a reliable, compact trim router.
author: Amazon Customer
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2025

label: Networking_Devices
review_title: Works well, fits my DIY CNC router mounting bracket nicely
review_text: This router works fairly well. The motor runs fine, though a bit loud (it is a router after all). The various brackets for straight edge and circle routing seem to work fine though they aren't the sturdiest I've seen they did ok when I tried them out. The best thing for me is that it fits the bracket for my DIY CNC router so I can use it to replace the 24V cordless trim router I was using (though I ran it via a power supply rather than using batteries). The depth of cut adjustments are fairly intuitive if you've ever used such a router before, it's fairly easy to adjust the height. The included bits are sharp and cut decently. All in all this is a fairly decent trim router and I'm satisfied with it.
author: Mark Massingill
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2025

label: Networking_Devices
review_title: Ease of Installation for those that are clueless to network connectivity.
review_text: 25 years ago, I installed server systems, terminals, printers, and network routers. All that networking equipment had to be set up with laptops directly connected to the routers' ports. Nothing was autosensing. I enjoyed it, but I knew what I was doing. Fast forward to today. I had to replace my own 25-year-old router because new laptops would not connect to it due to upgraded security software. I thought, Oh boy. I bet this is going to be a trip. I had forgotten most of what I knew; besides, I knew nothing about this new stuff. I picked this TP-Link AC1200. It was inexpensive, but we didn't need anything robust since we are not gamers. First of all, I ordered it on Amazon at about 3 pm. 8:30 pm, a car backs into my driveway. They delivered the router in less than 6 hours. Incredible! Today I went to install it. I was expecting a bit of a hassle with configuring this thing. After physically connecting the two cables ‚Äîthe power cord and the network cable ‚ÄîI powered it on. I went to my PC. The TP-Link showed up in my available networks. I click on it. Put in the password supplied. Got connected, but I had no internet connectivity. Ahh! I had to disconnect a cable from my MAIN in-house router, then reconnect it so that the router ID would be discovered. I went back out to the shop, clicked on Safari (I have an Apple MacBook). Wala, I'm IN. I could NOT believe how easy the installation went. No glitches, smooth operation, and my network is all updated. I know how networking operates, but I am clueless about all the newer equipment since I've been out of the field for almost 15 years. So, even a stupid person like me can set up this equipment that used to take a lot of training 25 years ago. This inexpensive wireless router is absolutely outstanding. I usually do not write such long reviews, but I could not let this pass without adding my thoughts about the TP-Link AC1200 WiFi Router. I'm so glad these routers were not around when I was in the field. If they had been, my great-paying job would not have existed. Now that I am retired, I'm happy for them, so I can still dabble on the Internet.

I love the ability to separate out my smart devices into a network dedicated solely to them, which the TP-Link is easily setup to do. I have a network setup for work on this router and generally use the T-Mobile router for anything other than the smart home devices.

label: Networking_Devices
review_text: I recently picked up the TP-Link BE3600 Travel Router and I couldn‚Äôt be happier with it‚Äîdefinitely a 5-star product! It‚Äôs been amazing to have a secure connection everywhere I travel, giving me peace of mind whether I‚Äôm in a hotel, Airbnb, or airport lounge. The setup is super simple, and managing it through the Tether app makes everything a breeze. One of my favorite features is having a network-side VPN when traveling. It‚Äôs great not having to configure each device individually, since everything connected to the router is automatically protected. Plus, I love that my family and I can connect all our devices without having to log each one into hotel Wi-Fi separately‚Äîour network stays the same wherever we go. If you‚Äôre looking for a reliable, secure, and easy-to-manage travel router, the TP-Link BE3600 is a fantastic choice. Highly recommended!
author: Aaron Harstine
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2025

label: Networking_Devices
review_text: Update: It is now April 21, 2020 and we've been using the router for 2 months. It is still working perfectly for us and we have zero complaints. I highly recommend it! We moved to the middle of nowhere about 7 years ago and it never occurred to us to check who provided TV/internet/phone at the new house before buying. We found out after buying the house that the only providers were satellite companies. We realized very quickly that first year that satellite sucks, the internet specifically. We got locked into a $75 a month plan with HughesNet for a year and never once were able to actually use the internet that whole year. It was really frustrating. We simply did not have home internet for the past 6 years due to a lack of a decent provider. This past week Spectrum finally moved their service to our road. We immediately signed up. I knew I wasn't paying them $5 a month to rent a router from them but I also wasn't sure at all how to pick out a router myself. I've always been pretty tech savvy but when you lose access(and a need) to those things you stop keeping up with them, I was seriously behind on all the new updates that have been made over the last several years. I knew I didn't want to spend more than $50 on a router and after doing some research I finally decided on this TP-Link AC1200 and basically just hoped for the best. Some of the reviews weren't great so I was nervous. It arrived a day after our internet was installed so I set it up by myself. It took me all of 20 mins from unboxing to the whole house having Wi-Fi, it was VERY easy. I love that it has it's own app, a very convenient feature. We live in a 2000sq. ft., one floor, manufactured home. These homes have pretty thin walls so the signal reaches from one end to the other very easily. We are also extremely heavy on our data usage in this family and while it's only been a couple of days now it has had zero trouble keeping up with us. We've had zero buffering while streaming & using our phones, everything has been working very quickly. We have several smart TVs, cell phones, a laptop, a printer & a PS4 connected to it at the moment. The technician from Spectrum who installed our internet also said this was a good option for our 200mbps plan. I hope this helps someone make up their mind on whether this router will be a good choice for them. I will update the review if anything changes but as of now this seems to have been a pretty solid purchase and I'm happy with it.

label: Networking_Devices
review_text: CAX Modem Review: Reliable Performance and Impressive Speed and save on ISP rental fees As an avid internet user who relies heavily on a stable connection for both gaming and entertainment, I recently decided to upgrade my modem and went with the CAX modem. After using it for a few months, here‚Äôs my take on this device. Design and Setup: The CAX modem has a sleek, modern design that fits well in my home office setup. It's compact, which is great for saving space, and the LED indicators are clear and intuitive, giving you an immediate status update on your connection. The setup process was surprisingly easy; I followed the instructions included in the box, and I was online within 20 minutes. The modem is compatible with most major ISPs, making it a versatile choice for different users. Performance: Where the CAX modem truly shines is in its performance. With my previous modem, I often encountered buffering issues and dropped connections during high usage times and packet loss. However, since switching to the CAX, I‚Äôve experienced significantly faster speeds, particularly when streaming 4K content or gaming online. The modem supports DOCSIS 3.1, which allows for lightning-fast download speeds, and I can confidently say it lives up to its promises. Connectivity: The CAX modem features multiple Ethernet ports, which is a fantastic addition for anyone with multiple wired devices. The Wi-Fi range is impressive as well; I‚Äôve noticed a stable connection even in rooms that previously had weak signals. This feature has been extremely beneficial for my family, enabling seamless browsing and streaming on multiple devices without any lag. Value for Money: With its robust performance and modern features, the CAX modem is reasonably priced, especially considering the cost savings on rental fees from ISPs. If you‚Äôre a heavy internet user, investing in a quality modem like this can lead to significant long-term savings. Conclusion: Overall, the CAX modem has exceeded my expectations. Its design is user-friendly, setup is a breeze, and its performance is flawless. For anyone looking to enhance their home network experience, the CAX modem is certainly worth considering.

label: Networking_Devices
review_text: Title: Nighthawk CA2700 Review Description: I see the Nighthawk AX2700 as a convenient all-in-one option that delivers solid Wi-Fi 6 performance for an average home on cable internet. It sets up quickly, handles typical streaming and work needs well, and offers enough wired ports to keep key devices stable. I‚Äôve also seen its limits: some users run into occasional Wi-Fi drops, slower-than-expected speeds, or gaming latency unless they use a wired connection. As with any modem-router combo, it trades flexibility for simplicity. For most households it‚Äôs a practical, good-value choice, but heavy network users or anyone needing maximum control may want separate devices.

author: JBonAmazon
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2025

label: Networking_Devices
review_title: Simple setup with Netgear app/Strong coverage
review_text: Bought this NETGEAR Nighthawk to avoid paying Spectrum for a router. If you're a Spectrum customer, this router works with the Spectrum modem. It arrived this morning and after 20 minutes it's up and running. We live in a one floor, 1500 square foot condo. Coverage is excellent throughout on 10 devices. The router is also small and fits nicely on our bedroom dresser. What I'm most impressed with is the setup and NETGEAR app. Download the NETGEAR app to your phone using a QR code provided on the instruction sheet. After establishing a NETGEAR account follow the prompts. This initial setup tutorial is fairly boiler plate, what sets this app apart is how it responds to issues. For example, if your router fails to connect on the first attempt, as mine did, it tells you precisely which settings to change on your phone to correct the issue. And these settings changes solved the problem in all three cases that occurred during my set up. I've never experienced this level of intuitive app support. I won't pretend to offer any review of the technical capabilities of the router, definitely outside my bandwidth, but if you're like me, comfortable with using technology, but needing guidance to navigate setups, this is a great product. The phone app is also easy to navigate and relatively self explanatory. To demonstrate, I ran a speed test from the phone app. It's way easier than using the settings function on your device. Download speed is 113.72 Mbps, Upload is 12.07 Mbps and Ping is 15.0 Ms. Do I fully understand what these mean, no, but with a small amount of research I could if issues arise. Bottom line, I'm so happy this product was easy to setup and am very pleased with the value. For a few months rental cost on my Spectrum Router, I avoid paying a lifetime monthly fee. I will leave it to others to debate the merits of the technical functions of this router. There is no debate in my opinion on the simplicity of setup and functionality.

label: Networking_Devices
review_title: Not working - factory reset made it worse
review_text: I bought this router as a recommendation of my ISP for our city's new Fiber. It is rated over 1 GB, which is what I'm getting from the city's link. I have an ISP who I highly recommend, and they helped me troubleshoot it as far as they could, and the result is, the fiber is up (I tested it by removing the router from the network and plugging my laptop directly into the city/ISP's device, and everything popped back to life.) The jury is not still out on this one. I can't recommend it to anyone. I go back to work tomorrow, and don't have internet in my home office. Neither does my wife. I'll have to run to Best Buy (Worst Experience Ever), or Walmart (they know nothing about anything), and pick something up that WILL work. I don't trust the things Amazon has been doing, so am not sure that I'll get anything back on this purchase. That's just under $100.oo wasted for a product that lasted almost exactly 6 weeks. I used to trust Netgear. It's been a while since I bought anything of theirs. Not since I stopped being an I.T. Director and don't need to purchase equipment for a company. But, my customers now are places everyone's heard of, like Vanderbilt U., the U.S. Senate, the House or Reps; Apple, Oracle, Facebook. You know, tiny companies... I'm not a happy camper. It's Sunday late, and nothing's open, and it sucks to be me. Oh wait, Walmart is open, and I got a TP Link Wi-Fi 6 router. It works fine, as long as I have Smart Connect turned on. With that off, the link is flaky. I tried that with the Netgear router, but it made very little difference. So, to date (it's been several days since writing the above), I was told by Amazon that I had to go to Netgear for help. They will require going through the standard troubleshooting steps, so I'll have to take my internet down and plug this thing back in, then a Netgear engineer will access the router and check stuff out... I may get a new one out of this, and I'll be okay with that. No such luck. I reset it and it stayed up a couple of weeks, but now is completely dead. I'm never buying Netgear again. They charge monthly fees for basic services on the thing. I'll never pay monthly for services like this. QoS, parental controls, etc SHOULD NOT BE SUBSCRIPTION SERVICES!
author: KLP99
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2024

label: Networking_Devices
review_text: I wanted a more secure WiFi router while also saving money on the rental from my cable provider, so I was suggested to purchase this by a very experienced tech and cyber security wiz. Now, I personally don't feel that I know much about anything technical these days, but I have really enjoyed this so far. Performance wise, but more than anything I REALLY love the security of the back-office type of controls the TP-Link gives you. PERFORMANCE Now, my current home is 1500 sq ft and a split level home, so most of the areas I use WiFi at home are never too far from the router. I placed the router right on the TV stand underneath the TV so that certainly is as close as it gets. When I'm upstairs (technically 1.5 levels up from the router) I still seem to get fine enough WiFi when I'm browsing on my phone. I will say that the WiFi randomly cuts out for me, but, this is definitely an issue I had with my previous equipment so I don't blame the router itself, it is my provider. Or the wiring outside my house.. not really sure. I have noticed however that when the service does go out, ever since changing to the TP-Link, the service returns much faster and I never have to reset it. With my old provider-provided router, it would be out for hours and I always seemed to have to manually reset the equipment. So in summary, the service and performance for me has been exemplary! SOFTWARE The primary reason I got this was to make sure nobody could hack into my WiFi. With other routers, I am not sure if the same service is available, but this was the first I've ever seen it. Yes... we all know that WiFi is password protected. BUT. Someone can easily hack into it, right? Well not with the TP-Link! You can access the router security through the routers IP address, and you set a password for that as well. The user interface is pretty simple for even a dolt like myself to understand. You can control who can access your WiFi by using a blacklist or a whitelist. A blacklist means that all who have the login details *except* for specific IP addresses you've blocked can access. A whitelist means that ONLY the IP addresses you have added to your list can access the WiFi. I am using the whitelist, since I do not want anyone random or unwanted accessing my service. Let me tell you, it works perfectly! Sometimes I forget that I have this setup, and I have tried many times with many different devices to try and access the wifi... heck, even the guest network, that I thought was specifically setup for this, doesn't seem to let random users access it. It also shows you who is currently accessing it, although I find that feature doesn't seem to be totally accurate sometimes. I give the software 5 stars for the simple fact that it is so easy to control access through it. SUMMARY Overall I am very happy with this purchase. It does what I want it to do, very securely. Setup was a little confusing because if I recall correctly, nobody could access it until we were able to get into the back-office software and setup password first. Other than that I really have had no issues and enjoy using it. When I need to change a setting it is super easy to get in and make any adjustments.
author: UAstudentn
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2022

label: Networking_Devices
review_title: Reliable WiFi 6 performance with real improvements across the whole house.
review_text: The TP-Link AX1800 WiFi 6 Router has been a noticeable upgrade in my home network, and everything here comes from my own experience using it in a fairly device-heavy household. I upgraded from an older WiFi 5 router that had started to struggle, and the improvement with the AX21 has been clear from day one. Setup was simple, but what I liked most was how much control the interface gives without feeling overwhelming. I used the browser setup and adjusted dual-band settings, enabled WPA3, and optimized the channel width in just a few minutes. The interface responds quickly, and making changes does not require constant rebooting or digging through hidden menus. The performance difference with WiFi 6 has been significant. I have multiple smart TVs, computers, phones, and IoT devices, and my previous router would slow down when several things were active at once. The AX21 handles everything smoothly. OFDMA and MU-MIMO keep the network stable even during heavy loads. I‚Äôve streamed 4K content, joined online meetings, and transferred large files all at the same time without interruptions. Coverage has also improved. I tested it with the WiFi Analyzer app for Android, which I‚Äôve used for years to check signal strength and network congestion. In areas where the old router consistently dipped, the AX21 delivered noticeably stronger and more stable readings. In actual use, this translates to fewer drops, steadier speeds, and better performance when moving between rooms. Beamforming makes a difference, especially with mobile devices. The wired connections are equally reliable. I connected my desktop and game console using the gigabit Ethernet ports and ran sustained transfers from a NAS. Speeds stayed at full gigabit with no fluctuations, and the router stayed cool throughout heavy use. Another thing I appreciate is how quietly and efficiently the router runs. It doesn‚Äôt heat up, even when multiple devices are streaming and downloading simultaneously, which says a lot about its hardware design. Based on my experience, the TP-Link AX1800 WiFi 6 Router offers a great balance of real-world performance, strong coverage, and easy configuration. It provides the benefits of WiFi 6 without the overwhelming complexity some high-end models add. For anyone looking for a reliable and technically capable upgrade, this router has been a very solid choice in my home.
author: Kambuko
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2025

label: Networking_Devices
review_title: Worked great for 58 days - then it didn't - Thanks Comcast
review_text: UPDATE 3 ************** You can read my sad tale below if you choose. But a quick summary may suffice. I got the SB8200 and it worked for 58 days. It then stopped working. It was replaced by Arris but the second modem did not work, either. That modem was replaced by Arris and the third modem did not work. The odds of getting three bad modems were pretty near zero so attention turned to Comcast. A tech came out and confirmed that the SNR was way low and the signal levels were out of bounds. He ran a new cable to the Comcast distribution box and installed a new splitter. The third modem connected immediately and worked perfectly. The fact that my old modem (not a docsis 3.1) worked had initially suggested that the problem was the new modem instead of the Comcast line. Arris support was GREAT through all this. I got right through to a live tech after about 3-5 rings (after their voice menu system answered and directed my call). They replaced the modems quickly (I had to send old modem back via ground - free return shipping - but they sent replacement modem via next day delivery). This is some of the best support of any company I deal with. It is pretty much the opposite of Comcast where getting to a live agent can be very difficult. This review was originally a 2 star but is now a 5 star - and I would give Arris support 6 stars if I could. ORIGINAL POST ********************* I have had this modem for 58 days. It was working well connected to Xfinity. Good download speed. Then, today it became intermittent. It ran for a couple of minutes, then lost internet connection, then was back but at slower download speed. Then it was running fine. That pattern continued to repeat. I had hoped it was an Xfinity issue, but I reconnected my previous modem and everything is working just fine. Before purchase I had read the bad reviews, but there were way more good reviews so I hoped that I would be one of those customers that got a "good one". Nope. Besides EVERY modem I looked at had about the same number of bad reviews. Many saying - don't buy this. So what is one to do? UPDATE ************** I contacted Arris customer support. I got through to a tech IMMEDIATELY. He said they needed to check the modem while it was online. Since I had already installed by backup modem, I had to contact Comcast and switch my MAC address back to the Arris and get in connected. I then called Arris back and again was connected to a tech, immediately. The reason this is a 2 star rather than a 1 star is because of the ease of contacting support. The tech looked at the modem stats and agreed it was bad. After a 5 minute delay while he consulted with a supervisor, he approved my return of the modem. He emailed me a prepaid shipping label and said they would send a new modem to me as soon as they received the old one back. So what Arris may lack in quality, they do mostly make up for in good customer support. Realistically, any product can fail, so the experience in dealing with a failed product is an important part of the buying process. Arris support gets 4 stars from me - one star off for making me reinstall the modem so they can verify it was bad. Though that was a perfectly reasonable request from them, I had pretty good evidence of my assertion that it was their modem which was the issue. Update 2 ********** I got the replacement modem. I spent about 90 minutes on the phone with Xfinity and Arris customer support trying to get that modem working with Xfinity. We could not get the modem to work - it seemed like it was working for a few seconds here and there. So I am sending this replacement back and will get yet another replacement (for the replacement). Hopefully the 3rd times the charm.

label: Networking_Devices
review_text: The previous three modems we've owned have been made by Arris, and very solid and reliable. So my expectations for the G54 were very high, especially considering that the cost is one of the most expensive on the market for a combo modem wifi router. It is very easy to hook up, with a power cord, incoming comm cable, and then whatever you decide to add for direct connections. The automation within this hardware is the most advanced that we've experienced. This will auto reset, and do a number of different steps (many which are beyond my comprehension) to ensure the connection is solid and to maintain accessibility. In testing the other wifi signals in our area, there is no interference or competing signals at the WiFi 7 range. Even for the lower ranges, the G54 is excellent about placing our signal in low use channel. All that to say, I've enjoyed this device for the last several months, and now feel like it was worth the cost since we've had excellent coverage ever since the initial connection was established (and sorted out with our provider).
author: S. Casey
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2025

label: Networking_Devices
review_title: STAY FAR FAR AWAY, Worked marginally for about 6 months then exhibited a number of defects
review_text: BUYER BEWARE: This product being a DOCSIS 3.1 Modem seemed to be safe and solid when I purchased last year on Amazon.com. Little did I know that problems would gradually start to increase with the Arris Surfboard SB8200, and seems to be an unfortunate pattern I have found with Arris Brand Cable Modems and Gateways. Customer Support is lacking and avoids addressing the issue while frequently diverting from the main problem they are asked to assist with. Arris brand products I have experienced continue to demonstrate noticeable defects and appear to be made with poor quality parts. I have purchased the Arris SB8200, SGB8300, SB6190 and SB6183 Cable Modems and Gateways and this is particularly if you have Cox Communications for an ISP, it is wise to reconsider this brand if you want a reliable internet connection and service. I strongly suggest you steer clear from this brand! The SBG8300, SB6183 and SB6190 all exhibited problems from the start, but this Surfboard SB8200 was particularly deceiving, since on the surface it seems that it would be a top performing product being DOCSIS 3.1 and not made with the Puma 6 Chipset some of us had the misfortune of experiencing defects with. I have now found this SB8200 device to be useless after 6 months and hours and hours troubleshooting with Arris customer support via chat, phone and email. You will be out of options when this product starts to fail, which for me is outside the return time frame with Amazon and Arris will refuse to take any type of accountability or responsibility for this failing product. The numbers of issues faced with this defective product has been extremely frustrating and caution a prospective buyer of this DOCSIS 3.1 modem to reconsider. Do yourself a favor, choose another brand Modem or Gateway. Anything with this brand made within the last 5 years I have noticed lacks basic performance and will begin to exhibit these issues and defects no later than 6 months into operation. I suspected it was my Internet Service Provider or Router that was the problem at first when I began to have increased and unexpected as well as unexplained internet outages. Knowing Cox had a history of preferring Arris brand equipment, I never suspected I would encounter problems with their products. After I could not ignore the unexplained connection drops and unusual amount of internet outages I finally uncovered this cable modem was the culprit, however was too late to recover the investment. It wasn't until a Cox technician noticed the unusually slow and odd way this modem rebooted after a connection drop and told me he had nothing but problems with this brand of equipment he never encountered with the others. I began to look into the problems with this product, and started to see a noticeable pattern of dissatisfaction from customers like myself. I have replaced this cable modem now with the Motorola MB8600 and had success with the modem and absolutely no issues since purchasing it. The MB8600 worked right out of the box, which I cannot speak for it down the road, but already seems more promising that any of the Arris brand products I have unfortunately purchased in the past. I thought I would provide a review on this product as I am able to speak now to the longevity of this Arris Cable Modem model SB8200 and a few other Arris products that failed prior to this one. This investment I made was a big mistake so hopefully this can help you make an informed decision which I strongly caution you all with purchasing this product.
author: AZDesertMonsoons89
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2022

label: Networking_Devices
review_text: So I've had this modem for a few weeks. I used to have a Motorola Surfboard 6141 I believe (going off memory). That modem at times would randomly drop speeds down to 1mb/s maximum for no reason, then throttle back up. I tried to research this and found out it might have been related to the Time Warner Maxx internet package I have (I'm grandfathered into a package that currently doesn't exist). No idea how or why that would matter but it seems to be the reason why my old Surfboard was having problems. So a deal hit and I dropped cash for this modem in hopes I could solve this problem fairly cheaply and so far its working. I haven't noticed any lag, no strange behavior like dropping to 1mb/s speeds, its been consistent and constant fast speeds, even above the stated speeds I should receive. The unit is well ventilated so the concern of heating up is not an issue. It's barely warm to the touch. I think as others have stated, if you put this in a confined space, for example an entertainment center with a glass door, then it'll heat up more than likely because there's no internal fan. But if you provide adequate air circulation then it'll function perfectly from my point of view. Also I wasn't able to successfully hook up the unit and remotely update to Time Warner that I am switching modems (Mac address) so I had to call them. The tech was able to get me going and took about 10 mins. All in all its so far a great intermediate modem.

label: Networking_Devices
review_title: Soooooooooo....... where‚Äôs my internet signal??? UPDATE: it‚Äôs alllllright!!
review_text: This thing is absolutely horrible. It has no reach. Gotta be right up on it dang near to get connected. I have it running with an even more horrible Tenda router. I even bought a WiFi booster and still no reach. And it‚Äôs tiny as heck. Over half the size lesser than my rental modem. I think I wanna keep paying the fees and return this. Update: March 20, 2023: I am changing my review from 1 star to 4 stars. If you need a modem, that you plan on using a router with, this could work. My COX internet service started going in and out. Tried troubleshooting the matter. Cox says they need to charge a technician out to my house. $75 to have someone come fix the very internet I am paying for. So I told them let me think about. ( that‚Äôs like paying for a medium steak, getting well done, and they charge you to have a chef come out and remake the very steak you paid for but aren‚Äôt getting) so I just Pulled this bad boy out of hiding, blew the dust off and reactivated it. Had a separate Cox rep swap the modem out. She did not try to charge me a tech. She was very nice and fast. And now I‚Äôm interneted up again lol. The difference now is, instead of that sorry, sorry excuse of a router by tenda, I‚Äôm using the very GREAT Rockspace Mesh 3 box set extender system. And I couldn‚Äôt be happier. The thing about this modem is it‚Äôs only one output. You could plug your cpu directly, or use a mesh. The mesh is the best bet. In the past, I had to get a larger data plan, (over $100/mo) bc the internet sucked. Cox upsold my plan. But check your equipment before letting ppl charge you. Now, I have a more basic plan, so I‚Äôm paying less, and still able to use all my devices just the same. And the netgear has stepped in place of the very heavy duty Panoramic Gateway equipment they give you. And so far, it is working exceptionally . So I actually would recommend this modem, paired with Rockspace Mesh system. And you got yourself some connectivity to knock your socks off. Very impressed. Btw: it was a little difficult to pair, bc I used it prior, so I had to reset both the netgear and Rockspace with their reset buttons to have the names revert back to the original SSID. Then it was simple from there.
author: Queen Lyrica
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2020

label: Networking_Devices
review_title: Dead after 2 months - WORST customer support ever, TERRIBLE warranty coverage
review_text: This modem worked fine for a couple months. Occasional disconnects, but not frequent. Then just over a week ago it started disconnecting frequently (like several times an hour) and for several minutes at a time, even for up to 10 minutes at a time. Called their tech support (over ONE HOUR on hold just waiting for someone) and they said the problem is with my ISP (Cox). So I call them and they send out a tech. In the meantime I have to wait about a week for my ISP tech to come out, in the meantime the signal dropping gets worse and worse (like for 15-30 minutes at a time, sometimes over an hour, and happening super frequently, like basically the internet signal only lasting for 5-15 minutes at a time). Thankfully when Cox came out they didn't charge me, but they found NO problems on the line, verified it with their equipment at each point. They added a power dropper anyway to make sure. The modem got worse for the next couple days, to the point where it basically won't connect at all, and instead just keeps restarting itself looking for a signal (that it can't process). So I call Netgear tech support back for a replacement, this time TWO HOURS on hold. Finally they walk me through the same stupid steps (reset the modem, etc.), and then they say the fact that it can't connect to the internet means it's a problem with my ISP, saying they weren't configured for my modem (even though they obviously were because it worked fine for two months with no changes). Ridiculous answer - they have NO IDEA how to troubleshoot their modems, just find ways to blame it on the ISP. After getting irate for a LONG time and they finally agreed to authorize a return (RMA). Turns out if you PAY to ship it back to them, they'll eventually send you a new one (with slow shipping). Worst warranty service ever, especially since their tech support is so terrible, and you have to wait on hold for hours just to even get anyone on tech support. I will NEVER buy anything from netgear again. You shouldn't either.

label: Toys_Kids
review_text: As a parent, I can wholeheartedly recommend this LEGO set. This set is absolutely fantastic and truly lives up to the "Classic" name by providing an incredible foundation for endless creativity. What I Loved: ‚Ä¢ Exceptional Value: Getting this many bricks, along with the handy storage box, for the price is an incredible deal. It offers hours of engagement for a minimal investment. ‚Ä¢ The Perfect Starter Set: If your child (or you!) is new to LEGO, this is the perfect place to start. It contains a wonderful variety of basic bricks in all shapes and colors, making it easy to build anything you can imagine. ‚Ä¢ Encourages Imagination: The included instructions for the train, car, and tiger are great jumping-off points, but the real fun is when my kids start creating their own structures and figures. The open-ended nature of this set truly fosters imagination. ‚Ä¢ Great Color and Brick Variety: The mix of bright, vibrant colors and the assortment of different specialty pieces (like eyes, wheels, and window frames) is well-curated. This allows for detailed and interesting builds beyond simple square houses. ‚Ä¢ Handy Storage Box: The iconic yellow storage box is a huge bonus! It's sturdy, keeps all the bricks tidy, and makes clean-up so much easier. Minor Considerations: ‚Ä¢ This is a "Classic" set, so don't expect highly specific themed pieces. Its strength is in the basic building blocks, which is exactly what we wanted! Conclusion: This set is an absolute staple for any toy collection. It's high-quality, promotes imaginative and fine motor skills development, and the durable storage box is the cherry on top. It‚Äôs perfect for kids and is one of the best LEGO values out there. Five stars! Highly recommended!

review_text: There‚Äôs a reason Play Doh is still the go-to brand after all these years. Fun and safe. This set is packaged for shipping, not for retail shelves. Not the best price you can find, but pretty good with free shipping. 2oz cans are tiny, but not as tiny as the 1oz ones. 4oz seems standard for ‚Äúfull size‚Äù these days, so these cans are half sized. Old school cans (the chipboard ones with the metal bottoms) apparently held 6oz, so these are a third of what full size used to be. Though modern Play Doh may be denser. These cans do seem quite small. The color selection is great, with the six rainbow colors, black, white, hot pink and teal. Since they‚Äôre basically ‚Äútravel size‚Äù cans but with a good color selection, this set would be ideal for travel. These are perfect for stocking stuffers, additions to gift bags, etc. They‚Äôd also be a great option for creating little custom Play Doh kits with unique tools not necessarily marketed for use with Play Doh - to promote creative thinking. Lots of different ways to use or gift these cans. I bought several to gift for toy drives and 100 neediest cases families. The feedback was very positive.

author: Kels
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2025

label: Toys_Kids
review_title: Unleashing Creativity with Play-Doh's 10-Pack Case of Colors
review_text: When it comes to finding activities that both entertain and educate my children, I always strive to give them experiences that not only spark their imagination but also enhance their developmental skills. That's why I was thrilled to discover the Play-Doh Modeling Compound 10-Pack Case of Colors, exclusively available on Amazon. This delightful set has quickly become a household favorite, bringing joy and creative flair to our family's daily routine. From the moment we opened the package, the vibrant array of colors captivated everyone‚Äôs attention. The set includes ten 2 oz. cans, each filled with a different, brilliant hue. The colors are not only appealing but also inspire a multitude of creative projects. Whether it's sculpting simple shapes or crafting intricate models, these Play-Doh cans provide the perfect material for all ages, making it an ideal choice for my children, who are 2 and 5 years old. What sets this Play-Doh set apart is its commitment to safety and quality. The compound is non-toxic, making it safe for younger children who are still prone to exploring textures with their hands and mouths. As a parent, it‚Äôs reassuring to know that the products I give to my children are free from harmful chemicals and safe for their use. Each play session with our Play-Doh case turns into a mini adventure. The kids start by choosing their favorite colors and then move on to decide what they want to create. On one occasion, my eldest decided to make a colorful garden with blue, green, and yellow Play-Doh, while my youngest was happy rolling balls and making small figures. Their creativity was astounding, and it was a joy to see their different personalities shine through their creations. The quality of the Play-Doh is commendable. Unlike some other modeling clays that dry out quickly or crumble, this compound retains its elasticity and vibrancy even after many uses. It's also easy to clean up, which as any parent knows, is a huge plus. We simply gather any stray pieces, store them back in their respective cans, and they're good as new for next time. Moreover, the addition of non-toxic Play-Doh to our play routine has provided a tactile learning experience for my children. Manipulating the dough helps develop their motor skills, and distinguishing between colors teaches them about the visual spectrum. They also learn problem-solving as they figure out how to manipulate the dough to match their creative vision. To enhance our Play-Doh sessions, we often incorporate educational themes. For example, we've used the dough to practice numbers and letters. I ask my children to form the shapes of different numbers and letters with the dough, which makes learning more interactive and fun. We also use the dough to form shapes and objects that relate to the stories we read together, deepening their understanding and engagement with the material. The inclusivity of Play-Doh also encourages sharing and cooperative play. My children have learned to share colors and tools, take turns showcasing their creations, and even collaborate on joint projects, like building a Play-Doh zoo that houses all sorts of colorful animals. These are valuable social skills that they carry into their interactions at preschool and playdates. In conclusion, the Play-Doh Modeling Compound 10-Pack Case of Colors has been a fantastic addition to our family‚Äôs playtime. It not only entertains my children but also serves as a tool for education and social development. The safety, quality, and vibrancy of this product make it a worthwhile purchase for any family with young children. I wholeheartedly recommend it to any parent looking to enrich their child's playtime with creativity and learning. Every can of Play-Doh holds a rainbow of potential, and we look forward to many more hours of fun and creation.

review_text: Fun little toy. Great for little ones (age 3+) as a stocking stuffer type gift. But useful for older ones also. Very versatile. Functioned as described / expected. Each of the 4 tablets included the stylus. At first, I thought a couple of them had suffered damage from shipping, but it was just from pressure on the screen. The tablets don‚Äôt turn off, so pressure on the screen will create light. I unlocked the delete toggle on the back, pressed the delete button, and voila‚Ä¶ no more marks on the screen. Then I just slid them back into their individual sleeves. This 4-pack is a decent deal for a lower quantity. Colors were as expected. I tested em before gifting. These little tablets are very simple - easy to use. The provided stylus does a great job with fine lines and responds well to even the slightest bit of pressure. The locking feature is nice‚Ä¶ to prevent accidental deletion of ‚Äúprecious‚Äù artwork. Didn‚Äôt have to change the battery, but seems pretty straight forward. There‚Äôs a tiny screw on the tablet edge. Loosen to pop out the old coin battery. Replace. Then retighten the screw. Great gift for kids‚Ä¶ or entire families. Definitely recommend.

They have the spots where magnets usually would be, however finding magnets for them I have found is an absolute nightmare. All the ones you can cut to shape and all of that do not hold it or are not thick enough to fill up the space for it. These are definitely a five-star item for just simple laying around the house use, but my entire use of them is notes on the refrigerator. I have a boogie board that I absolutely love but I cannot find them at a good value anymore. The bottom of mine broke so the pen does not stay in very well which is why I was replacing it. If these had a pen that was not so tough to get out I would give them five stars all day. They are not listed as being magnetic so that is totally not on the item, I just wanted people to be aware that if you're buying them with the thought of aftermarket magnets you will have a hard time finding something to fit the area made for them.

label: Toys_Kids
review_text: We had an older version of Candyland, but the cards were all bent up, so I ordered this one as a replacement. Right away I noticed the quality has gone downhill from my old version. The game board is barely thicker than posterboard so you'll need to be very careful with that. The cards are beyond thin - I had to laminate each one to give it longevity. The Candyland story insert was ripped upon receipt. Better quality materials need to be used since young kids are using this. Aside from quality problems, we love the classic game. My 4 and 10 year olds love the game, even though the 10 year old is way old for it, but we like to play as a family. It's the competitiveness for her that keeps her interested. Game play is simple, you choose cards and go the matching color, some spaces are double colors to move 2 instead of one. The best part is the specialty cards, in this version some of the characters are different such as the ice cream for Duke of Swirl and Grandma Gooey. What makes the game so fun is that you can be all the way at the end and get a specialty card like the cupcake that sends you back. My 4 year old is learning sight words, but can't read yet and no reading is required for this game. Each round can take 2-7 minutes depending on what cards you get, good for kids with short attention span. Classic family fun!

label: Toys_Kids
review_title: Amazing Interactive Device for Kids ‚Äî Keeps Them Active and Engaged!
review_text: The Nex Playground turned out to be one of the best kids‚Äô tech purchases we‚Äôve made in a long time. It‚Äôs a small cube-shaped camera that connects to the TV and tracks children‚Äôs movements in the room. No controllers, no remotes ‚Äî the kids themselves become the characters on the screen. It feels like having an interactive playground right in the living room. ‚úÖ Easy Setup Setting it up took just a couple of minutes. You plug it into the power and into your TV with HDMI, follow a few simple on-screen steps, and it‚Äôs ready to go. The device calibrates the room, connects to Wi-Fi, and immediately recognizes players. ‚úÖ Truly Active Play What I love most is that this is not passive screen time. My kids jump, run, reach, dance, and move constantly during the games. After 20‚Äì30 minutes they‚Äôre happy, tired ‚Äúin a good way,‚Äù and definitely more active than they would be with a tablet or phone. ‚úÖ Great Variety of Games The game library is surprisingly diverse. There are sports games, dancing games, obstacle courses, fun coordination mini-games, and even cooperative challenges for siblings or friends. You can choose games for different ages and moods, which is perfect for families with multiple kids. ‚úÖ Very Kid-Friendly The interface is simple, bright, and easy for children to navigate. There are no controllers to drop, lose, or break. Kids just stand in front of the TV and move ‚Äî that‚Äôs it. Even younger kids figure it out almost instantly. ‚úÖ Fun for the Whole Family This isn‚Äôt only for kids! Adults can join in and play too, and it turns into a super fun family activity. Great for rainy days, weekends, or playdates. ‚∏ª ‚≠ê What I Appreciate Most ‚Ä¢ Encourages physical activity ‚Ä¢ Helps reduce phone/tablet time ‚Ä¢ Kids stay engaged and entertained for a long time ‚Ä¢ Works well for single players or groups ‚Ä¢ Turns the living room into an interactive game space ‚∏ª ‚ö†Ô∏è Things to Keep in Mind Nothing major, but a few practical notes: ‚Ä¢ You need a bit of space in front of the TV for the camera to see the players properly. ‚Ä¢ Good lighting improves accuracy. Dim rooms can make the tracking less precise. ‚Ä¢ Younger kids can sometimes run out of frame and the device may ‚Äúlose‚Äù them briefly ‚Äî easily fixed by marking a play zone with a rug or tape. ‚Ä¢ A stable Wi-Fi connection helps games load faster. ‚∏ª ‚úÖ Final Verdict The Nex Playground is a fantastic alternative to passive screen time and a great way to keep kids active, engaged, and laughing. The tracking works really well, the setup is quick, and the game selection is excellent. My kids absolutely love it, and I highly recommend it to any family looking for fun, movement, and something different from traditional video games. Rating: 5/5 ‚Äî Totally worth it!

label: Toys_Kids
review_text: I love this gaming system! You can really tell the folks who developed these games are kids at heart and poured their love of motion controlled games into this project! I've had the Nex Playground for over a year and we couldn't be happier with it! There are some great games for people of all ages! Including adults! My 4 year old daughter uses it several times a week. Even my 11 and 13 year old boys enjoy playing it! I take it to work on "Fun Fridays". I'm a Cas Manager for adults with disabilities. Some of them only have the use of one arm and because of the AI body tracking these people who have never played a video game in their lives are having the time of their lives! My favorites are the bowling game (wow, how accurate the ball follows your hand movement), connect 4/basketball game, the baseball game (a huge hit with my boys and my clients), the mini game compilation game (ridiculous fun), the cookie monster puzzle game (cooperative gaming fun), the Mario kart inspired racing game (takes me back to the Wii era), the arrow shooting game (super fun to aim and hit targets), Zumba (is a great workout) and there are so much more and even more games are released throughout the year! I really believe this console deserves a place in every home in America! It's such a great time! A great workout! And I hope Nintendo is paying close attention! I do hope they make the tennis game 4 player, give us a 4 player air hockey game, and make the basketball game more accurate,

label: Gardening_Outdoor
review_title: Cultivate Your Green Thumb with Style and Ease
review_text: If you‚Äôre passionate about gardening and love to spend time nurturing your plants, this 9-piece gardening set is just what you need. It‚Äôs not just a set of tools; it‚Äôs a delightful gardening companion that makes every task feel effortless and enjoyable. With its durable construction and thoughtful design, this set has transformed my gardening routine into a more pleasurable and efficient experience. The standout feature for me is the quality of the tools. Made from stainless steel, each piece feels incredibly sturdy and is resistant to rust, which is a huge plus if you‚Äôre gardening in various weather conditions like I do. Whether I‚Äôm tackling tough soil or delicate seedlings, these tools handle it all without bending or losing their edge. It‚Äôs reassuring to know that this set is built to last, saving me from constant replacements. Another aspect that I truly appreciate is the ergonomic handle design. The wooden handles feel great in hand, providing a comfortable grip that minimizes strain during extended gardening sessions. This is a thoughtful touch, as it makes gardening more accessible for everyone‚Äîfrom kids to seniors‚Äîallowing us all to enjoy the art of cultivation without discomfort. And let‚Äôs not forget about the stylish and functional tote bag that comes with the set. I love how it keeps everything organized and within reach, plus the vintage floral design adds a charming touch to my gardening ensemble. The added convenience of having holes in the tool handles for easy hanging is a small but impactful feature that helps keep my shed tidy. Overall, this set makes a wonderful gift for any gardening enthusiast, offering both practicality and aesthetic appeal.

label: Gardening_Outdoor
review_text: Love this book! Five stars. Two thumbs up. All the good things. Recommend to EVERYONE!! I finished my second year of gardening and I wish I‚Äôd had this book two years ago! It covers a little bit of everything without going so in depth it's overwhelming, and without glazing over it leaving you frustrated and more confused. The charts make it automatically worth the buy. It has companion planting, pH and water needs for each plant, frost dates, and tons of others. It has lots of pages for you to write in the book for notes (which I won‚Äôt do because that‚Äôs sacrilege, but they are good ideas for pages in my garden binder). Each veggie has about three pages dedicated to it. Planting, Care, Pests/Diseases, Harvest/Storage are covered. Plus recommended varieties, general info and tips (like rosemary will deter Mexican bean beetles). It covers fertilizing, troubleshooting and so many helpful things, specific to a certain veggie. It also has amusing quotes at the start of every chapter. I really can‚Äôt say enough wonderful things about it. This is my absolute favorite gardening book and I think it should be on everyone‚Äôs shelf. Definitely the perfect Christmas gift for the gardener in the family!

label: Gardening_Outdoor
review_title: Simple, effective, low cost home garden option!
review_text: This is a great product and exceeded all my expectations. I've used "name brand" home hydroponics systems for years, but was tired of the prices going up and all the electronics failing on them, so I took a chance on this one. Plus, it's about the same size as the other ones but accommodates more pods! The pumping system is much simplified (which makes it easier to clean) , but just as effective and the timer is foolproof and doesn't have all the fussy electronics the "name brand" ones have. You do have to "set" the starting on-time live, meaning if you want the lights to come on at 4am you need to be awake then (which I am anyway) but that's a small trade off for having a much more robust (and simple) system. Overall, this system is sturdy, well built, and perfect for anyone wanting an economical, fool proof hydroponics system that I expect will last for years, far exceeding "name brand" alternatives. A must buy!!
