These have been great cameras they do lose connection freq but usually will connect back on there own sometimes, I like the functional saved position options also the talk back features capture features like most cameras now but these are good with clarity at nite I can't get the flood lights to work. Overall happy with them the sd card captures footage and loops Recommended I'm confused, I thought I was buying a hard wired camera that I could hard wire into my porch light for now to use as security camera, and it came with a plug ?? How is this an outdoor camera as instructions say to not get plug wet etc and should be plugged in indoors, Disappointed that there are no bright flood lights like my other cameras from other brands less expensive, and it does not seem to have a color option and seems to be only black and white, the nite vision was ok and has a good distance however the alarm strobe light is useless imo as it is a tiny light that blinks, the alarm on high volume is too low, the adapter plug has a 10ft thin cord it has sd option like all the other cameras do and 2 way talk, it says, have not tested that yet, but cannot find a color option all cameras have this now so I do not see why this one doesn't, I am going to test it for the next 25 days and if it doesn't function well will return it I guess, but I wish they would be more clear about how it is called an outdoor camera yet instructions says not to get adapter wet, set up was not difficult, they all work the same, the Alexa app has it listed as Alexa compatible and I linked it to the app, but overall compared to one I bought that has dual cameras on one for only 16.00 I do t think it is better or worth the extra $ It doesn't detect things as I think it should we tested it multiple times, I put sensitivity up high . Either way it's a disappointment when I thought I could wire it into my porch light wiring. So far it is working well has good night vision and even tho black and white and has no flood lights etc it serves it's purpose and tracks motion very well .

author: Anonymous
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2025

label: Security_Surveillance
review_title: Reliable and versatile indoor security solution
review_text: The Kasa Smart 2023 New Indoor Pan-Tilt Security Camera (EC71) is a versatile and feature-rich security solution for monitoring your home, pets, and babies. With its 1080p HD video quality, night vision, motion detection, and compatibility with Alexa and Google Home, it offers a comprehensive security package. Its ability to pan and tilt provides extensive coverage, and options for both local and cloud storage add to its flexibility. Key Features: 1. 360¬∞ Pan/Tilt Field of View: - The camera's 360¬∞ horizontal and 113¬∞ vertical range allows you to monitor an entire room or walkway. The Patrol Mode feature lets you set intervals to monitor different regions automatically. 2. Motion Tracking: - The camera can automatically track moving objects or people, providing real-time alerts to enhance your security system's effectiveness. 3. Detection & Instant Notification: - Get push notifications when motion or a person is detected. You can also enable baby crying detection, making it suitable as a baby monitor. Notifications help you discern important events from everyday activities. 4. 2-Way Audio with Built-In Siren: - The 2-way audio feature allows you to communicate with pets or family members remotely. The built-in siren can deter intruders, enhancing home security. 5. Secure Local or Cloud Storage: - Save footage on a microSD card (up to 256 GB, not included) or subscribe to Kasa Care for cloud storage with a 30-day video history and additional features like Video Summary and Activity Notifications with Snapshots. 6. Night Vision up to 30 Ft.: - The integrated IR system provides clear night vision up to 30 feet, ensuring you don‚Äôt miss any activity in low-light conditions. 7. 1080P Full HD Video: - Capture detailed 1080p Full HD video, making it easy to see small details like what your baby is holding or what your pet is playing with. 8. Works with Alexa & Google Home: - Compatible with Amazon Alexa and Google Home, you can use voice commands to view live streams on devices like Echo Show or Google Chromecast. Pros: - Extensive Coverage: The 360¬∞ pan and 113¬∞ tilt provide comprehensive room coverage. - Versatile Monitoring: Suitable for home security, pet monitoring, and baby monitoring. - Real-Time Alerts: Instant notifications for motion, people, and baby crying. - 2-Way Communication: Interact with pets or family members remotely. - Multiple Storage Options: Choose between local microSD storage and cloud storage with Kasa Care. - Clear Night Vision: Up to 30 feet of night vision ensures you don‚Äôt miss activity in the dark. - High-Definition Video: 1080p HD video for clear and detailed footage. - Smart Home Integration: Works seamlessly with Alexa and Google Home. Cons: - Occasional Slow Response: Some users report that the camera can be slow to respond at times. - SD Card Not Included: The microSD card for local storage is not included, which requires an additional purchase. - Subscription Cost: Accessing full cloud storage features requires a subscription to Kasa Care. Conclusion: The Kasa Smart 2023 New Indoor Pan-Tilt Security Camera (EC71) is a highly functional and flexible security solution for any home. Its wide range of features, including motion tracking, 2-way audio, night vision, and compatibility with smart home devices, make it a standout choice. While there may be occasional slow response times, the overall performance and ease of use make it a worthwhile investment for enhancing your home security. Recommendation: I highly recommend this camera to anyone in need of a reliable and versatile indoor security solution. Its extensive features, coupled with high-definition video quality and smart home integration, provide excellent value for the price. Whether you're monitoring pets, babies, or general home security, this camera is a robust and user-friendly choice.

author: Brighteyez
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2025

label: Security_Surveillance
review_text: These cameras are such a great deal! They are advertised as 2k resolution, but they are much lower. However this is fine, as the quality is still great for a security camera and the smaller size realistically means less data written to your microSD card if you are using local storage. I can still see everything with great detail. The pan and tilt features work great and it has motion tracking, although I personally leave them static and focused on a single location. It comes with a mounting bracket and you can invert the camera in the app, so you can mount it upside down if you want to attach it to a ceiling. I got these mainly for use at night. The built-in infrared lighting for night vision is powerful for such a small camera. It lights up everything in frame, although I am using them indoors, so the viewing distance is no more than 30ft in the biggest room of the house. Still, I see everything clearly. It also has the option to disable IR in case you prefer color, but this will come at a cost of less detail, as the sensor may not have enough light to light everything up. You can also select a mode to have it use night vision, but diable its own infrared light, incase you are using a separate external infrared light. I don't think you would need an additional infrared light unless you were planning to use this outside and over a larger distance. Overall, really happy with these cameras for the price. They definitely give more peace of mind and make the home feel more secure. If you are planning to get these, I'd recommend ordering some microSD cards and using local storage so that you dont have to pay for cloud service. Their cloud service plans for what they offer are pricey, and aren't worth it IMO, but to others they might be.

I especially like the live tracking feature where if the camera detects a human, it will attempt to track and follow that person around the room. At first, it seems very unreal and kind of creepy that a camera is following you, but I've gotten used to it and it's great so that you can review the footage later and follow the motion. The set up to my wireless network through the app was straight forward, very easy to connect on the first try and the connection has been strong ever since. author: Kyle
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2025

label: Security_Surveillance
review_title: Fully featured cameras without the subscription.
review_text: These are great cameras! Easy to install and set up, no subscription required, and they have been up fivemonths without problem. The solar panels seem to charge them very effectively, only needing to charge about every three days, and you can track that through the app very easily. These have pretty much every feature you could want in a home security camera. The one feature I wish they did have ( and could probably be added later through firmware update, hint hint Eufy) is the ability to have the cameras scan an area regularly. You can set a default position and multiple additional views in the app, but have to switch between them manually. It is great that I can view recorded clips and live footage from anywhere very easily and everything is stored locally at my home with no subscription. AI features are good and constantly improving as well.
author: Shawn W
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2025

label: Security_Surveillance
review_title: Perfect Solar-Powered Camera for Simple Home Security
review_text: This is the second security camera I've purchased, and it's a significant upgrade! My first experience was with a Blink camera, which was a decent entry-level option, but the monthly fees were a downside. What I immediately loved about this camera is that it doesn't require any monthly subscription. I've always been intrigued by 360 cameras but wasn't sure which one to choose. When this one popped up as a Black Friday deal, I jumped at the chance, and I'm so glad I did. The installation was straightforward, with easy-to-follow instructions. It connects to Wi-Fi effortlessly, making setup a breeze. I had it professionally mounted on the side of my house, and the image quality is excellent. The audio is also clear, making it a high-quality camera overall. The fact that there's no mandatory monthly fee is a huge plus, though there's an option to upgrade if desired. Video storage is handled locally on the camera. It's important to note that motion detection recordings, such as people approaching or cars stopping by, are automatically deleted after 24 hours. While you can purchase additional storage if you need to keep videos longer, I personally find the 24-hour storage sufficient for my needs. I'm comfortable with the videos disappearing unless there's a specific recording I want to save or download. For those seeking a simple, reliable camera to monitor their front door or home, I highly recommend this one. The solar panel feature is a game-changer. No need to worry about changing batteries or complicated wiring, as it charges itself continuously.
author: Maria G.

label: Security_Surveillance
review_text: I had been searching a subscription-free security system for a longtime. I learned about Eufy's systems from my daughter. I read the review and chose the wireless system vs the wired system. I don't mind working around my house, but I refuse to crawl in the attic to connect the wired system. Installing the wireless was easy, just had to used an extension ladder two of the cameras. All the cameras work great as well as the clarity of the pictures from the cameras. Great product!!! Good value for the money.

review_text: These cameras are pretty good. Good clarity, good tracking, not too sensitive or lacking sensitivity. Picks up wildlife around my property when I have animal detection turned on. Human tracking is ideal. I do recommend following the installation instructions and mount the camera(s) so they detect at an angle. Head on monitoring doesn't always pick up a person approaching the house. Easy setup and if you need a larger amount of storage, purchase the Home Base. Battery life is good. The solar panels recharge the batteries well. The only downfall I have found is that when viewing Live View, there is an annoying pop-up every couple of minutes causing you to either keep live view going or cancel live viewing. I rely heavily on live view and I monitor my battery level so I don't need a pop-up that cancels the live view if you don't choose to continue it. I have sent a suggestion to the manufacturer explaining my issue. I think (I'm no pro at how this all works) it may just be a programming change in software (app). We'll see. Anyway, aside from that, I would recommend the to someone looking for good PTZ, solar charged security cameras.
author: J.T.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2025

label: Security_Surveillance
review_text: I wanted a self directed camera system. So far so good. Tons of app settings. You can change recording lengths. Motion following. 7 GBs of internal storage that can be transferred to your own drives. Optional alarm sounds and strobe light (alarm is too loud, use the light). You can talk through the camera to speak to intruders or your own family. Hopefully the solar works well but I need more time to find out. You cannot setup auto cloud storage and the device will delete old videos when it reaches capacity, but it has a solid built in storage capacity. Overall, it‚Äôs a very capable security camera at a low price point for a DIY unit. I am likely buying more after I see how well the solar panel charges it.

review_text: Works great, has good image quality and a lot of options, like censoring some parts of the camera, selecting a specific area to register activity, and programming times. It says it works with alexa, i managed to link it, sadly, routines aren't available.

label: Security_Surveillance
review_title: Excellent Budget-Friendly Camera With Clear Video and Fast Setup
review_text: The Blink Mini 2 has been an impressive upgrade for a compact home security and pet monitoring camera. Setup was extremely quick, and the app walks you through everything step by step. The video quality is crisp during both day and night, and the motion detection is responsive without being overly sensitive. Audio is clear on both ends, which makes it useful for checking in on pets or communicating through the camera when needed. The compact size makes it easy to place almost anywhere without drawing attention. For the price, the performance, reliability, and ease of use are excellent, making this a great choice for simple home monitoring.

review_text: Huge improvement over the blink 1! It has a great wide view and I can check the camera from my phone almost instantly, even internationally. This has been a great way to check on things even when I‚Äôm not home. Really good camera quality and the night vision works too. You don‚Äôt even need to pay the subscription if you don‚Äôt care about recording. Super simple set up.

label: Security_Surveillance
review_text: First time trying any camera system. These were easy to set up. Clear view image and has different settings you can adjust. Only thing i dont like is it does not do constant recoding it only records on motion and it send a notification to your phone every time it is triggered by motion. You can silence the notification for up to 24 hours then you have to go back and turn the silence notification back on after the 24 hours if you don‚Äôt want the notification to keep popping up on your phones you can also choose to arm or disarm the system arm from app on the phone. I would buy these again. We have since added wireless outdoor ones from blink system and they seem to work well so far they run on 2 AA lithium batteries and sync easily with the wires indoor cameras we already had set up in the app.

label: Security_Surveillance
review_text: Bought this Blink camera for a lady who was having theft in the home where she lived. Great quality picture, easy to use and set up takes 10 minutes at the most. Detects motion, Blink is known for a quality product. I have 6 Blink cameras love them and I would highly recommend this product
author: Les H.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2025

label: Security_Surveillance
review_text: I got this camera to look into the downstairs of my house from upstairs or when I was away from the house. I installed it where I thought I would have the best view of the most rooms from one spot and wow was I impressed. It picks up my entire kitchen, my breakfast area and my family room and even part of my dining room from one well placed location. The video is actually pretty high-quality considering the wide angle fixed lens. The night time or dark room quality is OK, but noticeably limited in field of view as the illumination is very weak. My only wish would be for a longer power cord to allow for more mounting options. The full trial service includes recorded video and other nice features that you will have to sign up for and pay for to continue to use. The camera still works after the trial period and you can still look in from your phone from the app from anywhere, you just won‚Äôt have recorded video. Setup was easy and the mounting hardware was included.
author: Amazon Customer
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2025

label: Security_Surveillance
review_title: What a wonderful stuff have Blink !
review_text: I first bought the Blink mini camera (April 9, 2023). It's recommended for indoor use, but I use it outdoors in the shade during the summer heat of Las Vegas, NV (109 degrees Fahrenheit) and in the winter, and I've never had any problems. The camera is practically bulletproof. The image and sound quality are excellent, and the installation and app are easy and convenient. Of course, I've already bought another camera, the Blink mini 2, and the installation was practically automatic. I only had to enter my Wi-Fi password, and the camera was ready. It's very easy to move them; you just unplug and plug them back in at the new location. I haven't bothered about copying the recordings yet‚ÄîI mean, saving the files to a USB drive‚Äîbut with Blink, I imagine it must be super simple. So far, it's one of the best products I've bought on Amazon. The Blink mini 2 works wonderfully.
author: sonderangebot
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2025

label: Security_Surveillance
review_title: Great for Outdoor Use, But Lacks an Indoor Privacy Mode
review_text: For the price you pay, this camera is honestly great. It works very well outdoors and gives you solid video quality, clear motion detection, and easy setup. My only issue is when using it indoors, it really needs a privacy mode that physically hides the lens. A simple shutter would make a big difference in terms of peace of mind. Overall, excellent value for the price, just missing that one feature for indoor use.

It is an excellent product at a good price.
author: Connie
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2025

label: Office_Printer_Supplies
review_title: Caution: Bad printing after installing Instant Ink
review_text: I really like this printer. It perfectly meets my needs. It came with a small amount of ink to get me started. I decided to do the Instant Ink program. The first batch of ink took some time to arrive. I also signed up for the paper program. They sent me about 150 sheets the first time. It is nice paper. I got the Instant Ink cartridges and we have had trouble with them drying out or something. If I run the troubleshooting to clean the ink cartridges, then it prints fine. PROBLEM IS that under Instant Ink, your plan is a set number of pages/month. I went with 50 as I do not print a lot. BUT with this ink problem, I can get a page printed correctly followed by a half page of garbled print. I will return to update this review after HP figures this out and figures out how to compensate me for the badly printed pages.

label: Office_Printer_Supplies
review_title: Solid printer that helps in making great copies.
review_text: I like this printer very much. It replaced an older one. The new one feels much more solid than the older one. That was a pleasant surprise based on the trends of today‚Äôs products which almost always seem cheaper. Set up is easy. And there were choices of how and where to set it up. It also tracks ink usage and automatically sends ink when needed. Never run out of ink. And the program pricing is much better than buying one off at retail. The printer does everything I need. It is not too noisy either. It does seem to take a bit longer to print but the printed documents are very high quality. It also prints photos better than any printer I have had. It has a feeder. The great thing is when you use the manual platen you don‚Äôt need to place the document in an exact position. The printer detects what you are printing and adjusts itself. No more crooked or off center copies. That is great for me. As printers go the price, size and quality make it top notch.

review_text: What can you say about HP printers really? They are arguably the industry leader and they're the most universally supported brand on the market. author: Robert BENDER
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2025

label: Office_Printer_Supplies
review_title: Perfect printer for at home use!
review_text: Perfect affordable printer for at home use! It was super easy to set up. HP support has a video on their YouTube channel of how to set it up, and it was really straight forward. After you take off the tape and plastic liners, it has you download the HP app and the app guides you through setting up the WiFi, paper, & ink. Overall from unboxing to printing my first sheet, it probably took about 15-20 minutes. Setting up my WiFi and connecting to my phone was a breeze. I don‚Äôt have a computer so I was worried about finding a printer that could easily print from my phone, but this was very simple and easy to do. I was able to print documents directly from my files, as well as photos from my photo app. It takes a little less than 30 seconds per sheet, which isn‚Äôt bad for an at home printer, but could be slightly irritating if you‚Äôre printing over 50 pages at a time. The ink is great, prints pretty true to color. The black is saturated, and the colored ink is slightly less vibrant but that‚Äôs not an issue for me personally. I added a photo of what it looks like printing via the HP app, as well as the printed page afterwards. As you can see, the black is nice and saturated, the red is slightly less saturated but nothing bad, and it prints very accurately. This is perfect for my homeschooling needs, & for less than $40 I‚Äôm very happy with it. Pros : - printer and copy machine in one - comes with ink both black and colored - black ink is nice and saturated - an additional 3 month free trial to their ink subscription - after the trial the ink subscription isn‚Äôt very expensive either which is great. - 1 year warranty included - affordable printer (bought on sale for $35) - set up took less than 20 minutes start to finish - prints fast enough for at home use - can print straight from my phone, either from files or photo library Cons : - colored ink is slightly dull, but not too bad as long as you‚Äôre not printing actual photos. - the print speed could be an issue for you if you‚Äôre printing over 50 pages at a time
author: jay
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2025

label: Office_Printer_Supplies
review_title: A great inexpensive little printer, scanner, copier all in one quiet compact unit
review_text: I purchased the HP Desktop Printer for home use, primarily for assistance when writing Amazon product reviews and it has proved invaluable for keeping my paperwork organized. After several weeks of use I‚Äôm satisfied with its performance. It works as expected and has greatly improved my daily routine. Setup took just minutes, the instructions were clear and everything connected immediately. No user manual was included but YouTube videos helped with any questions I had. It prints, scans and copies efficiently all in one quiet compact unit. Unlike other printers I‚Äôve used in the past, I haven‚Äôt had a problem losing Wi-Fi connection and the print speed is extremely fast with the ability to print right from my computer, tablet or phone. I did read it only supports 2.4GHz WiFi networks so keep that in mind before you purchase. The ink supply that was included is holding up well even after extensive use and the cartridges were easy to install. Since I will primarily be printing in black and white I like the fact that I can print in single cartridge mode, which means I will only have to buy black ink cartridges. The print quality is not the best but acceptable for my purposes. The paper tray feels solid and doesn‚Äôt jam. I plan to download the HP Smart App soon. The product exceeded my expectations in terms of quality. It was well packaged, durable, the design both functional, space saving and attractive. At a price of just $38.89, this Amazon limited time deal offered exceptional value compared to similar products. It arrived in great condition and on time. Highly recommended.
author: Eva Huet
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2025

label: Office_Printer_Supplies
review_title: Solid All-in-One Printer with Great Wireless Features
review_text: I've been using the HP DeskJet 2827e for about two months now, and overall, I'm quite satisfied with this printer. The setup process was straightforward - I had it connected to my WiFi and printing from my phone within 15 minutes. The wireless printing capability is excellent. I can easily print from multiple devices including my laptop, tablet, and smartphone without any connection issues. The HP Smart app makes it simple to manage print jobs, check ink levels, and even scan documents directly to my phone. Print quality is solid for everyday documents and casual photo printing. Text comes out crisp and clear, and colors are reasonably accurate for home use. The scanner works well too, producing clean scans suitable for digital archiving and email attachments. However, there are a couple of drawbacks worth mentioning. First, the printing speed is somewhat slow compared to higher-end models - it's not a problem for occasional printing but could be frustrating if you're printing large documents regularly. Second, like most inkjet printers, the ink cartridges don't last as long as I'd hoped, especially if you print in color frequently. The HP Instant Ink subscription helps manage costs, but it's an additional ongoing expense. Despite these minor issues, this printer offers great value for home users who need basic printing, scanning, and copying capabilities with wireless convenience. It's compact, relatively quiet, and does exactly what most people need without breaking the bank.
author: andrew

label: Office_Printer_Supplies
review_text: It was easy setup and installation. It came with instructions. Just need some computer knowledge to set it up. It works great!
